Title: Data Analyst, New Grad & Entry Level
Description:
Gateway is a leading financial institution that provides banking and mortgage services to individuals and businesses. The Servicing Data Analyst I will support the Mortgage Servicing division by performing data analysis and modeling to enhance operational processes and ensure compliance with financial regulations.




Responsibilities




Performs loan analysis and data modeling to help make recommendations for process improvement.
Leverages technology resources to improve department processes and lower risk.
Assists in the monitoring of the department's operational budget and provides support to the development of operational strategies to meet company's objectives.
Works with Corporate Accounting, Finance and Treasury to reconcile core servicing system with general ledger and bank activity.
Monitors regulation changes, implements processes for adhering to changes and coaches and trains to these changes.
Validates data integrity for mortgage servicing transfers, audits or special projects.
Develops and implements servicing operations policies, procedures and training guidelines ensuring they are carried out according to established requirements.




Qualification




Required




Basic knowledge of data analysis, data modeling, predictive analytics, statistics and related software applications
Basic knowledge of process improvement and project management methodologies
Advanced Excel, SQL or similar query language skills
Strong execution skills with the ability to implement new processes and procedures.
Excellent communication skills and presentation skills with ability to interact with and relate to all levels of the organization.
Ability to read and interpret program guidelines and establish new processes in compliance with those guidelines.
Exemplifies the Gateway Values: Growth Oriented, Make a Difference, Get it Done Attitude, Team Player, Street Smart.
Bachelor's Degree with a concentration in Accounting, Finance, Information Management, Business, Finance or Mathematics
0-2 years of related experience in the financial services industry.
Show more
HTML:
Gateway is a leading financial institution that provides banking and mortgage services to individuals and businesses. The Servicing Data Analyst I will support the Mortgage Servicing division by performing data analysis and modeling to enhance operational processes and ensure compliance with financial regulations.


Responsibilities


  • Performs loan analysis and data modeling to help make recommendations for process improvement.
  • Leverages technology resources to improve department processes and lower risk.
  • Assists in the monitoring of the department's operational budget and provides support to the development of operational strategies to meet company's objectives.
  • Works with Corporate Accounting, Finance and Treasury to reconcile core servicing system with general ledger and bank activity.
  • Monitors regulation changes, implements processes for adhering to changes and coaches and trains to these changes.
  • Validates data integrity for mortgage servicing transfers, audits or special projects.
  • Develops and implements servicing operations policies, procedures and training guidelines ensuring they are carried out according to established requirements.


Qualification


Required


  • Basic knowledge of data analysis, data modeling, predictive analytics, statistics and related software applications
  • Basic knowledge of process improvement and project management methodologies
  • Advanced Excel, SQL or similar query language skills
  • Strong execution skills with the ability to implement new processes and procedures.
  • Excellent communication skills and presentation skills with ability to interact with and relate to all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to read and interpret program guidelines and establish new processes in compliance with those guidelines.
  • Exemplifies the Gateway Values: Growth Oriented, Make a Difference, Get it Done Attitude, Team Player, Street Smart.
  • Bachelor's Degree with a concentration in Accounting, Finance, Information Management, Business, Finance or Mathematics
  • 0-2 years of related experience in the financial services industry.

Title: Data Analyst (Entry Level)
Description:
Job_Summary:

Supernova Technology is a cloud-based software solution provider focused on securities-based lending. They are seeking a Data Analyst to support product managers and tech leads in developing their lending system, ensuring timely and high-quality project implementation.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Work with product manager to define back testing and validation plans for new analytical models and perform testing and analysis

‚Ä¢ Carry out data analysis, comparison, and validation for product deployment projects for new clients to ensure high quality contents and functionalities

‚Ä¢ Participate process improvement projects in data flow and operations

‚Ä¢ Perform financial security data research and analysis, develop model such as multivariate regression analysis, simulations, or portfolio risk analytics




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in finance, engineering, or technology related fields

‚Ä¢ Highly analytical and quantitative thinking

‚Ä¢ Self-starter with high level of motivation

‚Ä¢ Detail oriented yet Systematic thinking yet is able to focus on details

‚Ä¢ Team-oriented

‚Ä¢ Proficient in SQL

‚Ä¢ Proficient in MS Office Suite, especially Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint




-Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience in data interpretation

‚Ä¢ Experience in financial services, wealth management, or education industries




Company:

Supernova Technology offers a cloud-based, fully-customizable, end-to-end software solution to automate securities-based lending from origination through the life of the loan. Supernova Technology‚Ñ¢ has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Pivotal Partners is exclusively partnered to scale a Series B ($40mil) Gen AI startup. We are looking to aggressively expand our presence by hiring a Data Analyst for our Product team.




Location: US or Canada (Remote)




Job Description:

We‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join our Product team as the technical bridge between Product, Engineering, and Go-To-Market. In this hybrid role, you'll design and maintain solution blueprints, out-of-the-box (OOB) assets, and proof-of-concept (PoC) environments that let prospects experience product value early in the sales cycle.




You‚Äôll own how our latest GenAI innovations show up in demos and PoCs‚Äîensuring every prototype, dashboard, and workflow reflects the cutting edge of our platform. By translating raw customer data and business goals into clear, compelling technical narratives, you‚Äôll accelerate deals and bring critical field insights directly into the product roadmap.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and Maintain Reusable Solution Blueprints for fraud, credit, AML, and onboarding use cases‚Äîintegrating the latest product features and innovations.
Lead Pre-Sales Prototypes and PoCs, tailoring demos to highlight core and differentiating product capabilities using real or synthetic datasets.
Conduct Deep Data Analysis and Feature Engineering using SQL, Python, and big data tools to surface risk signals, engineer features, and build rule logic.
Build Story-Driven and Visual Data Narratives through dashboards, notebooks, and interactive visualizations to clearly convey business value to diverse audiences.
Create and Maintain Demo Environments, ensuring GTM teams have fast access to realistic, compelling, and up-to-date demo setups.
Capture Field Insights and Influence Product Roadmap, channeling customer needs and solution patterns back to Product and Engineering.
Develop Enablement Materials, including playbooks, how-to guides, and training content to support internal teams and partners.




Requirements:

Experience: 7-8+ years in solution architecture, data analytics, or pre-sales engineering for B2B SaaS- MUST BE in fintech, risk, data, or AI.
Technical Skills: Expert-level SQL and data wrangling; proficiency in Python (or R) for ad-hoc analysis and feature engineering.
Solution Expertise: Proven ability to create PoCs/pilots that convert prospects into customers and keep demo environments current with rapid product releases.
Domain Knowledge: Familiarity with fraud prevention, credit risk, or AML compliance is a strong plus.
Show more
HTML:
Pivotal Partners is exclusively partnered to scale a Series B ($40mil) Gen AI startup. We are looking to aggressively expand our presence by hiring a Data Analyst for our Product team.


Location: US or Canada (Remote)


Job Description:

We‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join our Product team as the technical bridge between Product, Engineering, and Go-To-Market. In this hybrid role, you'll design and maintain solution blueprints, out-of-the-box (OOB) assets, and proof-of-concept (PoC) environments that let prospects experience product value early in the sales cycle.


You‚Äôll own how our latest GenAI innovations show up in demos and PoCs‚Äîensuring every prototype, dashboard, and workflow reflects the cutting edge of our platform. By translating raw customer data and business goals into clear, compelling technical narratives, you‚Äôll accelerate deals and bring critical field insights directly into the product roadmap.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and Maintain Reusable Solution Blueprints for fraud, credit, AML, and onboarding use cases‚Äîintegrating the latest product features and innovations.
  • Lead Pre-Sales Prototypes and PoCs, tailoring demos to highlight core and differentiating product capabilities using real or synthetic datasets.
  • Conduct Deep Data Analysis and Feature Engineering using SQL, Python, and big data tools to surface risk signals, engineer features, and build rule logic.
  • Build Story-Driven and Visual Data Narratives through dashboards, notebooks, and interactive visualizations to clearly convey business value to diverse audiences.
  • Create and Maintain Demo Environments, ensuring GTM teams have fast access to realistic, compelling, and up-to-date demo setups.
  • Capture Field Insights and Influence Product Roadmap, channeling customer needs and solution patterns back to Product and Engineering.
  • Develop Enablement Materials, including playbooks, how-to guides, and training content to support internal teams and partners.


Requirements:

  • Experience: 7-8+ years in solution architecture, data analytics, or pre-sales engineering for B2B SaaS- MUST BE in fintech, risk, data, or AI.
  • Technical Skills: Expert-level SQL and data wrangling; proficiency in Python (or R) for ad-hoc analysis and feature engineering.
  • Solution Expertise: Proven ability to create PoCs/pilots that convert prospects into customers and keep demo environments current with rapid product releases.
  • Domain Knowledge: Familiarity with fraud prevention, credit risk, or AML compliance is a strong plus.

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst
Description:
DMI is a leading global provider of digital services with over 30 years of experience in the sector. They are seeking a passionate and detail-oriented Data Analyst to leverage data for business decisions, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and develop impactful dashboards and reports.




Responsibilities

Design and Develop Dashboards: Create dynamic, visually engaging dashboards and reports in Domo that provide real-time insights to stakeholders across various departments, ensuring data is actionable and easy to interpret.
Data Extraction and Transformation: Extract data from multiple sources, transform it into usable formats, and ensure its consistency, accuracy, and reliability for analytical purposes.
Advanced Data Analysis: Conduct detailed analysis on large datasets, utilizing statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that inform key business decisions.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and operations, to gather business requirements and translate them into analytical queries that drive decision-making.
Report Automation: Build automated reporting tools that provide stakeholders with timely access to key performance indicators (KPIs) and other relevant metrics, ensuring the business stays informed on critical developments.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement and monitor data validation processes to ensure the integrity of the data used in analysis, including identifying and correcting inconsistencies and errors.
Predictive Analytics: Develop predictive models to forecast business outcomes and customer behaviors, helping the company anticipate changes and make proactive adjustments to strategies.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field is required.
At least 2 years of experience with data analysis, SQL querying, and data reporting.
Domo: Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with Domo for data visualization, dashboard creation, and analytics.
SQL: Strong proficiency in SQL to query databases, manipulate large datasets, and perform complex data joins and aggregations.
Excel: Advanced skills in Excel, including experience with formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis tools.
Data Warehousing & ETL: Experience with data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Data Visualization: Ability to create impactful data visualizations and reports using tools like Power BI or Tableau, in addition to Domo.
Statistical Analysis: Strong foundation in statistical methods and models to perform predictive analytics, trend analysis, and correlation analysis.
Data Quality Management: Skills in ensuring data quality, accuracy, and consistency through validation checks and error identification.
Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze complex datasets, draw meaningful insights, and recommend data-driven solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to present insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Problem Solving: Strong problem-solving abilities, with a focus on using data to address business challenges and identify growth opportunities.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail, ensuring that all analyses and reports are accurate and error-free.
Prolonged Sitting: Must be able to sit for long periods while working at a computer workstation.
Repetitive Motions: Frequent repetitive movements such as typing on a keyboard and using a mouse.
Visual Focus: Ability to consistently focus on a computer screen for extended periods, with good near-vision capabilities.
Occasional Lifting: May need to lift objects such as laptops, documents, or small office equipment, usually weighing under 20 lbs.
Mobility: Able to move within an office environment, including attending meetings, and collaborating with team members.




Preferred

Advanced degrees such as a Master‚Äôs in Data Analytics or Business Intelligence are preferred but not mandatory.
2+ years of hands-on experience working with Domo for data visualization and analytics is preferred but not mandatory.
Familiarity with other data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI is a plus.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis is a plus.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Entry Level
Description:
Job_Summary:

Criteo is a global technology company that serves personalized online display advertisements to consumers on behalf of e-commerce companies. They are seeking a Data Analyst to partner with commercial teams, design and analyze A/B tests, and communicate market trends to support strategic planning.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue

‚Ä¢ Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests

‚Ä¢ Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives

‚Ä¢ Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams

‚Ä¢ Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation

‚Ä¢ Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.

‚Ä¢ Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral

‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios

‚Ä¢ Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution

‚Ä¢ Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python

‚Ä¢ Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context




-Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Previous experience with MySQL

‚Ä¢ Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts




Company:

Criteo is a global technology company that serves personalized online display advertisements to consumers on behalf of e-commerce companies. Criteo has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Analyst Entry Level
Description:
Tier4 Group is a women-owned and diversity-certified technology Talent, Professional Services, Advisory, and Information Security firm with a national reach. They are seeking a Data Analyst to join a collaborative team focused on delivering insights and reporting solutions, improving data accessibility, and enhancing business performance through actionable analytics.




Responsibilities

Partner with stakeholders to define requirements and deliver analytical solutions
Design and develop Power BI dashboards and reports
Write and optimize SQL queries for data analysis
Validate data accuracy and ensure reporting integrity
Document processes, assumptions, and methodologies
Translate complex findings into digestible business insights and recommendations
Support enterprise efforts to increase data literacy and drive data-informed decisions




Qualification




Required

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, Statistics, Business, or a related field
1‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, or application development
Proficiency in analytical tools such as SQL, Excel, and Power BI
Ability to communicate technical insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving, research, and critical thinking skills
Demonstrated initiative, adaptability, and ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Power BI development experience
Proficient in writing SQL queries
Collaborative mindset and ability to work across teams




Preferred

Experience creating and maintaining dashboard and process documentation
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to generate actionable insights
Data storytelling capabilities to convey trends and findings to business stakeholders
Experience with data validation and quality testing

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst
Description:
PNY Technologies, Inc is an American manufacturer of flash memory cards, USB flash drives, solid state drives. They are seeking a Data Analyst to develop reporting tools and ensure the accuracy of worldwide reporting while collaborating with various departments to analyze company data.




Responsibilities

Understand, utilize and implement new reporting tools like Power Bi
Work closely with IT to develop reporting tools in Power Bi, Excel, etc.
Partner with different departments to prepare and analyze company data
Collecting and analyzing data from various sources, such as supply, inventory, forecasts, and market trends
Developing and maintaining reports, Power BI Dashboards, and metrics to measure and evaluate the performance within individual departments
Data Cleaning and Preparation: Ensure data quality by cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, including handling missing values and filtering data.
Statistical Analysis: Perform statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Data Visualization: Create visualizations to represent data insights clearly and effectively using tools like Power Bi, Tableau, or similar.
Predictive Analysis: Utilize machine learning techniques to forecast future trends and outcomes based on historical data.
Strategic Planning: Assist leadership with strategic planning by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.
Assist with special projects and in other areas, as assigned.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in Accounting or related field
2+ years relevant experience
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail a must
Ability to adhere to strict deadlines
Strong knowledge of accounting principles & experience with Excel, Power Bi, Cube/Data Warehouse
Good written and oral communication skills, including ability to communicate effectively in English

Title: Data Specialist I (New Grad)
Description:
CorVel is a nationally recognized claims management and managed care provider with over 30 years of experience in the industry. The CareIQ Data Specialist I role involves gathering, organizing, and presenting operational data while ensuring data quality and compliance with integrity policies.




Responsibilities

Supports and contributes to data collection efforts
Supports and partners with team members and management across departments and units
Runs delivered reports as needed
Enters data from source documents into prescribed computer database, files and forms
Ensures quality and consistent data collection
Reviews large sets of data and may break down into desired final output
Packages and present data, both client-facing and for internal communication
Verifies data and facilitates corrections when necessary
Manages data request intake queue; responds timely to requests for information
Complies with data integrity and security policies
Additional projects and duties as assigned

Title: Analyst, Analytics (New Grad & Entry Level)
Description:
Publicis Media is a leading media agency network, and they are seeking an Analyst to join their Analytics team. The role involves analyzing media performance, generating actionable insights, and producing reports to optimize media strategies for clients.




Responsibilities

Analyze media performance across multiple channels and identify actionable insights.
Calculate and compare KPIs using dashboards, Excel and other tools to support business reporting.
Write basic SQL queries to extract data from internal databases.
Produce campaign performance updates, hindsight reports and ad-hoc analysis.
Summarize key findings and trends through clear and concise reports and presentations.
Collaborate with internal teams to identify performance drivers and inform recommendations.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor's degree in quantitative, marketing, or communications-related field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Marketing, Business, Data Science, etc.)
1+ year experience working with data sets using Excel and SQL in an academic, internship or professional capacity.
Intermediate to advanced Excel and SQL skills required (pivot tables, IF statements, joins and lookups, etc.)
Proficiency visualizing data in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to QA others‚Äô work as well as your own.




Preferred

Experience with media metrics or marketing data sources via coursework, internships, or entry-level roles is a plus.
Familiarity with BI/dashboard tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio strongly preferred.
Exposure to Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Meta Ads Manager or similar platforms is helpful but not required.

Title: Data Analyst, Entry Level
Description:
Job_Summary:

Webster University is seeking a full-time Data Analyst in the Office of Institutional Effectiveness (OIE). The Data Analyst provides data support for the University's strategic and operational planning, and is responsible for external reporting, completing surveys, and conducting institutional research.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Provides data support for the University's strategic and operational planning and decision-making

‚Ä¢ Program planning and review

-Required:

‚Ä¢ Experience with dashboard tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or R Shiny

‚Ä¢ Experience with or desire to learn Python or R for data analysis

‚Ä¢ Experience with multi-table reporting with SQL

Title: New Grad Data Analyst
Description:
Publicis Sapient is a digital consulting firm that offers consulting, technology, and product management services. Razorfish is looking for an Analyst to join its Data Science and Analytics practice, where you will contribute to data-driven projects and collaborate with clients and team members to deliver insights and strategies.




Responsibilities

Learn all facets of the data from its origin and extraction to its interpretation and use
Understand Razorfish‚Äôs data capabilities and how data fits into a client's overall strategy
Understand the breadth of data services and crafts
Help to manage data team responsibilities within cross-capability projects
Identify / focus on key issues and objectives based on internal and client needs with oversight
Active listener and seeks to positively contribute to internal discussions
Prepare internal and client presentations with oversight
Write clear and concise summaries of own work
Participate actively in meetings with internal and external clients
Prioritize work to meet internal and external client deliverables

Title: Data Analyst (CRM), Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

NMQ Digital is a fast-growing digital services company that specializes in supporting multinational companies with various digital marketing solutions. They are looking for a Data Analyst (CRM) to design data pipelines, analyze marketing campaign performance, and collaborate with teams to optimize strategies.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design and maintain integrated data pipelines combining CRM platform data (e.g., SFMC) with web analytics (Google Analytics) for unified campaign reporting.

‚Ä¢ Analyze email marketing campaign performance: open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and revenue impact.

‚Ä¢ Conduct A/B tests on email subject lines, content, and CTAs; analyze results to recommend optimizations.

‚Ä¢ Develop interactive dashboards and reports (Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio) that provide clear, actionable insights on campaign effectiveness and customer engagement.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate closely with marketing, sales, and data engineering teams to understand data needs and support campaign strategy.

‚Ä¢ Validate data quality and ensure compliance with privacy and security standards.

‚Ä¢ Identify trends, anomalies, and customer behavior patterns to optimize marketing strategies and customer retention efforts.

‚Ä¢ Support segmentation and personalization initiatives by leveraging CRM and behavioral data.

‚Ä¢ Assist in the creation of customer retention models and customer lifetime value (CLV) analysis.

‚Ä¢ Provide insights and recommendations to improve multi-channel marketing efforts and overall customer journey.

‚Ä¢ Document processes, dashboards, and data definitions to ensure transparency and reproducibility.

‚Ä¢ Mentor junior analysts on CRM data best practices and analytics techniques.




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or a related field

‚Ä¢ 2 years of experience in CRM analysis, marketing analytics, or data-driven campaign optimization

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of CRM platforms, preferably Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) or similar

‚Ä¢ Experience integrating marketing data from multiple sources (e.g., SFMC, Google Analytics)

‚Ä¢ Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, DOMO)

‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and campaign optimization

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies, segmentation, and conversion funnel analysis

‚Ä¢ Understanding of marketing KPIs: open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, revenue attribution, engagement metrics

‚Ä¢ Awareness of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and best practices for data compliance

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills; ability to translate technical findings into actionable business insights




-Preferred:

‚Ä¢ advanced degree preferred




Company:

NMQ Digital (formerly known as IST@ease) is a global provider of digital marketing execution services.

Title: Data Analyst (Associate)
Description:
Job_Summary:

Cloud Imperium Games is a leading game development company known for its innovative and immersive gaming experiences. The Data Analyst will leverage cloud platforms and advanced analytics tools to analyze gaming data, providing actionable insights that drive improvements in sales, game stability, and player engagement.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design, build, and maintain dashboards, visualizations and reports

‚Ä¢ Audit metrics for malformed/unoptimized data

‚Ä¢ Design and implement automation jobs for transformation and aggregation

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with stakeholders and translate their requests to actionable results

‚Ä¢ Highlight trends that can provide marketing and sales insight

‚Ä¢ Educate analytics consumers on usage of data visualization software

‚Ä¢ Prepare regular reports on sales and marketing performance

‚Ä¢ Identify areas for improvement of visual reporting

‚Ä¢ Continual education in new technologies and methodologies




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ Three or more years experience as an analyst or other relevant experience

‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills, written and verbal, with ability to present complex data insights clearly

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail and consistent self-review practices

‚Ä¢ Eye for aesthetically pleasing visuals and user-friendly dashboard design

‚Ä¢ Proficiency with SQL and experience working within cloud platforms (Google Cloud Platform and AWS)

‚Ä¢ Ability to break down technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders across various departments

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with one or more of the following technologies: Python for data analysis and automation, Google Analytics for web and user behavior analysis, Cloud Platforms (Google Cloud Platform and AWS), ElasticSearch for data search and analytics, Kibana for data visualization and monitoring, Tableau for business intelligence and reporting




-Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience with E-Commerce or Game Monetization analytics

‚Ä¢ Advanced experience with cloud platform services including BigQuery (GCP) and Redshift (AWS) for large dataset analysis

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with additional data processing tools such as Spark, Athena, Redshift, Jupyter Notebooks

‚Ä¢ Experience with design and project management tools (Figma, JIRA)

‚Ä¢ Degree in relevant fields (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Business, Economics, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with Big Data projects and cloud-native analytics solutions

‚Ä¢ Background in gaming industry analytics or live service game data analysis

‚Ä¢ Experience with data pipeline automation and cloud platform data workflows (GCP and AWS)




Company:

Cloud Imperium Games is a new kind of independent studio dedicated to delivering AAA experiences outside the established publisher system, founded by Chris Roberts, creator of the best selling Wing Commander and Freelancer series, Cloud Imperium is currently developing Star Citizen, a record-shattering crowd funded title that combines classic space sim gameplay with Hollywood-caliber visuals. Cloud Imperium Games has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Responsibilities


Usage of different platforms to manage Data.
Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisions
Creation of Dashboard in different platforms (Power BI, Tableau, Service Now) to cover the needs of the organization.


Education, Skills And Experience Required


Last year of Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science and Engineering
Fluent English.
Good presentation skills
Understanding of the printing industry
Office 365 expertise
Customer oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in language to be supported.
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.
Advanced proficiency with case management databases and tools.
Superior customer service skills.
LEAN knowledge (preferred)
Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.


What We Offer


Curricular Internship agreement between university, company, student
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to a Culture of Inclusion & Belonging

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance in all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement. Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst, Competitive Intelligence
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our AXSI team, you'll be at the forefront of measurement and experimentation. Your role will be crucial in helping our clients understand and maximise their return on investment while driving innovation in the rapidly evolving digital advertising landscape.


Incrementality measurement: Enable advertisers to quantify and understand the true value of Criteo's solutions through sophisticated measurement methodologies
Client Consultations: Partner with advertisers to deeply understand their business objectives and define meaningful success metrics for their advertising investments
Experimentation Design: Craft and implement robust testing strategies tailored to each client's unique needs and business context
Analysis & Communication: Transform complex experimental data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for clients
Measurement Innovation: Contribute to our suite of measurement tools, enabling teams across Criteo to evaluate and optimise their initiatives
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges
Solid foundation in statistical inference methodologies and experience in designing and analysing A/B tests
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies
Ability to synthesise complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY

  • Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
  • Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
  • Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
  • Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
  • Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
  • Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
  • Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • 1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
  • Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
  • Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
  • Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Great spoken and written English.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable

  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

2-4 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos o roles similares.
Buen manejo de herramientas BI (Power BI, Tableau, Looker...) y de lenguajes como SQL o Python.
Capacidad anal√≠tica y orientaci√≥n a resultados.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you're looking for a change, eager for new challenges, and you're a Data specialist... keep reading, because this opportunity might be just what you're looking for!




We‚Äôre currently looking for a Data Analyst to join a growing Global Digital & Consumer Marketing team within the beauty and lifestyle sector.




You‚Äôll be part of a dynamic, cross-functional team supporting multiple brands across different markets. Reporting to both the Head of Consumer Data and the Consumer Data Tech Director, you‚Äôll play a key role in enhancing consumer insights and improving the overall customer experience across ecommerce and omnichannel platforms.




Key Responsibilities:




Segment customers and perform deep-dive analyses to support targeted campaigns.
Deliver strategic insights to improve customer experience, retention, and growth.
Build and maintain dashboards for performance, CRM, and eCommerce teams.
Automate reporting and promote a self-serve analytics culture.
Analyze marketing campaigns and provide actionable recommendations.
Collaborate with Data Engineering and key stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and availability.




Requirements:




Strong SQL skills and ETL pipeline experience.
Background in statistics or quantitative analysis (Python or R is a plus).
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Looker, Power BI, or similar).
Experience with advanced analytical models and customer & marketing analysis.
Solid understanding of the digital ecosystem and channel attribution models.
Ability to clearly communicate complex findings to non-technical audiences.
Self-starter with excellent time management, high standard of quality and stakeholder engagement skills.




What working with us will offer you:




The chance to take part in challenging projects within a dynamic environment.
A stable position with a clear career path within the company.
Permanent contract from day one.
Full remote work model.
Flexible compensation options and meal vouchers, among other benefits.




If you're interested in this opportunity and would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply so we can get in touch, provide you with all the details, and answer any questions you may have.

Agap2 is an equal opportunity employer.




We are committed to treating all applications fairly based on skills, achievements, and experience. We encourage everyone to apply ‚Äî all applications will be considered equally regardless of race, nationality, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic.

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

  • Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
  • Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
  • Company products / Access to the company shop
  • Life and accident insurance

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • A screening call with the recruiters
  • A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
  • A second interview (optionally)
  • Feedback, verbal offer
  • Hiring

About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Description -

The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Responsibilities


Usage of different platforms to manage Data.
Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisions
Creation of Dashboard in different platforms (Power BI, Tableau, Service Now) to cover the needs of the organization.


Education, Skills And Experience Required


Last year of Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science and Engineering
Fluent English.
Good presentation skills
Understanding of the printing industry
Office 365 expertise
Customer oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in language to be supported.
Experience in troubleshooting in a technical environment.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.
Advanced proficiency with case management databases and tools.
Superior customer service skills.
LEAN knowledge (preferred)
Analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
Software and hardware knowledge of computing, storage and peripheral devices.


What We Offer


Curricular Internship agreement between university, company, student
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models


Legal entity: sales and services

Job -

Administration

Schedule -

Full time

Shift -

No shift premium (Spain)

Travel -

Relocation -

Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO) -

HP, Inc. provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and prospective employees, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sexual orientation, age, disability, or status as a protected veteran, marital status, familial status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic predisposition or carrier status, uniformed service status, political affiliation or any other characteristic protected by applicable national, federal, state, and local law(s).

Please be assured that you will not be subject to any adverse treatment if you choose to disclose the information requested. This information is provided voluntarily. The information obtained will be kept in strict confidence.

If you‚Äôd like more information about HP‚Äôs EEO Policy or your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law ‚Äì Supplement

Title: Data Analyst (Based in Spain only)
Description:
Imagine yourself‚Ä¶


Growing your expertise and expanding your skillset with every project.
Owning your ambition and fueling your career growth.
Joining a company with a proven track record of success and an exciting future.


It‚Äôs all possible with a role at Esko (https://www.esko.com/en/company/about-esko) . Esko, a Veralto (https://www.veralto.com/) company, is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. Our integrated platform and comprehensive tools empower retailers, pre-media and trade shops, manufacturers, and converters to manage best-in-class packaging design and print processes.

Innovation in the is built into the DNA of our business: every day, we challenge ourselves to be better by seeking out new ways to elevate our products, our processes, and our people.

We also know that innovation and ingenuity starts with prioritizing a diverse workforce and a deeply inclusive workplace. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our‚ÄØpositions.‚ÄØ

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll work on a variety of customer-focused data projects, driving impactful insights and solutions. This is a remote position based in Spain. Candidates based in other countries will not be considered.

In This Role, a Typical Day Will Look Like


Connecting data sources ‚Äì Establish and manage reliable connections to a variety of internal and external data sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Transforming and preparing data ‚Äì Use SQL, Power Query, and other tools to clean, blend, and structure data for reporting and analysis.
Designing dashboards & reports ‚Äì Build intuitive, visually compelling dashboards in Power‚ÄØBI that surface key metrics and performance trends for a wide range of stakeholders.
Analyzing trends & patterns ‚Äì Drill into datasets to uncover drivers, anomalies, and opportunities that inform strategic and operational decisions.
Presenting insights ‚Äì Communicate complex findings to both technical and non‚Äëtechnical audiences through presentations, reports, and live demo sessions.
Partnering with the business ‚Äì Collaborate closely with product, operations, and commercial teams to translate business questions into analytic deliverables.
Occasional travel within Spain and across Europe to participate in workshops and meetings, fostering collaboration and aligning data initiatives with broader company goals.


The Essential Requirements Of The Job Include


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Business, Economics, Data Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
~1 year of experience (including internships) in a Data Analyst or similar role, working with real‚Äëworld datasets.
Strong SQL skills for querying and manipulating relational databases.
Hands‚Äëon Power‚ÄØBI experience creating interactive dashboards, reports, and data models.
Experience with DAX and Power Query) to build effective analytical solutions.
Foundational statistical knowledge (e.g., distributions, hypothesis testing) and an analytical mindset.
Excellent English communication skills , both written and verbal, with the ability to explain data insights clearly.


It Would Be Great If You Have


Proficiency with Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib) for data manipulation and visualization.
Exposure to cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) and version control (Git).
Knowledge of data storytelling and visualization best practices .


Esko is proud to part of the Product Quality & Innovation segment of Veralto (NYSE: VLTO), a $5B global leader dedicated to ensuring access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods. When you join Veralto‚Äôs vibrant global network of 16,000 associates, you join a unique culture and work environment where purpose meets possibility : where the work you do has an everyday impact on the resources and essentials we all rely on, and where you‚Äôll have valuable opportunities to deepen your skillset, pursue your ambitions, and grow your career. Together, we‚Äôre Safeguarding the World‚Äôs Most Vital Resources‚Ñ¢‚Äîand building rewarding careers along the way.

At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you‚Äôve ever wondered what‚Äôs within you, there‚Äôs no better time to find out.

Unsolicited Assistance

We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at any of the Veralto companies (https://www.veralto.com/our-companies/) , in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position, approved by Talent Acquisition, will be deemed the sole property of Veralto and its companies. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Veralto and its companies because of the unsolicited referral.

Veralto and all Veralto Companies are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. We value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Unimedia Technology is looking for a Data Analyst with a strong foundation in data engineering to support our next-generation digital signage and advertising platform. This platform is already being used by major clients across Europe, and your contributions will directly enhance our ability to deliver accurate and timely insights.

You will play a key role in sourcing, preparing, and maintaining geographic and postal data, collaborating closely with product and development teams to ensure our data systems are accurate, efficient, and scalable.




Key Responsibilities
Research and acquire geographic, postal, and point-of-interest data from public and commercial sources.
Build and maintain scripts and pipelines to ingest, clean, and validate data.
Load structured datasets into a PostgreSQL database for downstream processing and analysis.
Collaborate with Product Owners and developers to ensure data quality and relevance across the platform.
Maintain clear documentation of workflows, scripts, and data structures to ensure transparency and reproducibility.







Required Qualifications
Proficiency in SQL, particularly with PostgreSQL.
Experience with Python or a similar language for data processing and automation.
Good understanding of data quality concepts, data cleaning, and data transformation techniques.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.







Preferred Qualifications
Experience with GIS tools such as QGIS or PostGIS.
Familiarity with version control systems, especially Git.
Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.
Basic understanding of PHP for occasional integration tasks.
Fluency in additional languages, especially those applicable to international postal systems.
Comfort with Linux/bash scripting and working in a command-line environment.




What We Offer
Competitive salary within the range of ‚Ç¨30,000 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨42,000, based on experience.
A flexible working environment.
Hybrid postion
English lessons 101
Private Health Insurance
The opportunity to contribute to a platform used by major European clients.
Professional development opportunities in both data analytics and data engineering.







Show more
