HTML:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a world-class Data Analyst to join and be part of the People Analytics team as an owner of insights and data-informed people decisions. You will have an incredible opportunity to drive impact within People Analytics and bring a high level of rigor to your work.

THE JOURNEY

  • Observe, identify, and solve analytical problems in the People department: issues include, but are not limited to, unifying data sources, improving data quality, enhancing the accuracy of measurements, and optimizing workflows and processes
  • Take ownership of reporting on the Employee Performance, Engagement, Diversity, and Inclusion metrics and KPIs, and supporting key business analytics in the department
  • Support on maintaining current tools and reports, primarily using Tableau, Excel (Google Sheets), Workday, Google AppScript, and Python
  • Use your analytical skills and technical mindset to solve inefficiencies within the People teams and assist them in making data-informed decisions
  • Write SQL queries in Amazon Redshift
  • Automate reports and processes while exploring GenAI strategies and opportunities
  • Communicate with stakeholders who come from non-analytical backgrounds and ensure that the relevant teams are aligned
  • Contribute to raising the bar of analytics usage and understanding within the People department. You will have the opportunity to make a great impact on the internal teams and the company's success through People Analytics

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or any technological domain
  • 1-2 years of experience in data analytics
  • Passion for analytics: you enjoy deep-diving into problems to uncover root causes and drive improvements
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Strong command of SQL
  • Working knowledge of Python frameworks such as Pandas and Numpy
  • Proficiency in creating impactful visualizations using Tableau or Looker, demonstrating strong data storytelling and analytical capabilities
  • Familiarity with HR trends and People Analytics is a plus
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders
  • Hands-on attitude with high standards, proactive, organized, and obsessed with details
  • Fluency in English

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).



Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Digital Data Analyst - Spanish Speakers in Spain
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.




Qualification path

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish language
Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Jr Operations Analyst
Description:
Murphy AI is a next-generation debt collection platform powered by artificial intelligence, designed to optimize recovery rates while maintaining respectful and personalized communication. Our advanced automation streamlines the process of collecting overdue invoices for businesses, providing a seamless and effective solution.

Our platform integrates effortlessly with ERP systems or supports CSV uploads to ensure smooth access to data on unpaid invoices. Using AI-driven agents, we engage with debtors across multiple channels, including SMS, email, phone calls, and more. For cases where payment arrangements are unsuccessful, we facilitate escalation to legal proceedings through trusted partnerships with law firms.

As a fast-growing startup that has already made an impact within just a few months in the market, we are building a talented team to scale our operations and drive our vision forward. Join us in redefining debt recovery with innovation and empathy.

Type: Full-time, Hybrid in Barcelona

üíº About The Role

As a Jr Operations Analyst at Murphy, your mission is to analyzing, optimizing, and executing operational processes within Murphy AI. This is a highly analytical and hands-on role, ideal for someone eager to work in a fast-paced startup environment. You will work closely with our operations, product, and engineering teams to improve efficiency, support decision-making with data, and drive continuous improvement in our AI-powered debt collection processes.

This role is perfect for someone hard-working, detail-oriented, and highly analytical, with a background in business, engineering, or related fields.

üìù Responsibilities


Analyze operational processes and identify inefficiencies or areas for automation.
Work with data, extracting insights to improve recovery rates and optimize workflows.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to refine AI automation and ensure operational effectiveness.
Support the onboarding and integration of new clients, ensuring seamless adoption of our platform.
Monitor key operational metrics and proactively identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
Optimize internal processes, helping Murphy AI scale efficiently while maintaining quality.
Execute and improve existing workflows, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in all operations.


üìö Requirements


Degree in Business, Engineering, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills ‚Äì ability to work with large datasets and derive actionable insights.
Highly organized and detail-oriented, with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Excellent proficiency in Excel / Google Sheets and familiarity with SQL or data visualization tools is a plus.
Strong work ethic ‚Äì comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-performance environment.
Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Interest in AI, automation, and data-driven decision-making.


‚≠êÔ∏è Soft Skills


Problem-Solving & Critical Thinking ‚Äì Ability to break down complex problems and find solutions.
Strong Work Ethic ‚Äì A high level of commitment and willingness to go the extra mile.
Data-Driven Thinking ‚Äì Comfort with numbers and using data to drive operational improvements.
Ownership & Accountability ‚Äì A proactive mindset, taking responsibility for tasks and seeing them through.
Communication Skills ‚Äì Ability to explain insights clearly and work effectively with different teams.


ü§ù What We Offer

üí∞ Salary: ‚Ç¨25.000 ‚Äì‚Ç¨30.000 gross/year

üìà Stock options: Because we all build Murphy together ‚Äì you'll own a piece of what we‚Äôre creating.

üß© Impact: Be part of our startup journey from day one, playing a key role in our growth and building something meaningful from the ground up.

üìö Learning: Continuous development through trainings, knowledge-sharing, and exposure to other top-tier startups in our ecosystem.

üç± Healthy meals: No more boring tupperware ‚Äì enjoy daily meals with Nora Foods. We cover 50% of each order!

üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Ride into work: Forget traffic jams ‚Äì hop on your Panot e-bike and cruise to the office! We cover 50% of your subscription.

üõú Hybrid & Flexible: Our default setup is hybrid ‚Äì 3 days a week at our office in Poblenou, surrounded by a thriving tech scene, and 2 days of remote work. But if there‚Äôs one thing that defines us, it‚Äôs flexibility: we trust you to organize your time and space in the way that helps you do your best work.

üìö Our Process

We believe that hiring is a two-way street: while we get to know you, you also deserve the chance to understand who we are, how we work, and what makes Murphy AI special. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:

1Ô∏è‚É£ First Interview ‚Äì Getting to Know You

A conversation with a future teammate who‚Äôs excited to find a new colleague. We‚Äôll talk about your story, what drives you, and what you‚Äôre looking for next‚Äîno trick questions, just a genuine exchange.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Second Interview ‚Äì Deep Dive

You‚Äôll meet the Hiring Manager and potentially another team member. This is a more technical discussion where we explore your skills in detail, walk through real scenarios, and answer any questions you might have about the role.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Tech Assessment or Business Case

A practical exercise to see how you approach challenges similar to those you‚Äôd tackle at Murphy. You‚Äôll have time to reflect and showcase your thinking‚Äîno rush, no surprises.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Coffee at the Office with the Founders

Finally, you‚Äôll join us in our Barcelona office for a relaxed coffee with the founders and the Hiring Manager. It‚Äôs the perfect opportunity to experience our culture firsthand and meet more of the team who could soon be your colleagues.

üëâ To learn more about how we hire and what to expect at every step, feel free to explore our Hiring Guide!

üëâ We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace where everyone, regardless of background, identity, or experience, feels valued and empowered to thrive. We believe that different perspectives drive innovation and success, and we actively foster an environment where all voices are heard and respected.

Title: Analista Digital
Description:
Nuestro cliente ayuda a organizaciones a mejorar su eficiencia y competitividad combinando datos, dise√±o y tecnolog√≠a. Ofrecen consultor√≠a y acompa√±amiento end-to-end, desde la conceptualizaci√≥n del negocio hasta su madurez digital. Se especializan en modelar y automatizar flujos de negocio centrados en la gesti√≥n de clientes.

Buscamos un Analista Digital con experiencia, que domine el entorno de Adobe Analytics, Customer Journey Analytics y Adobe Experience Platform. Su funci√≥n principal ser√° optimizar las estrategias, mejorar el rendimiento y fundamentar las decisiones de negocio. Para este puesto es fundamental la comprensi√≥n del catal√°n, y valorable que lo hable, debido a un proyecto con un cliente local.

RESPONSABILIDADES


Recopilaci√≥n de Datos: Utilizar herramientas como Adobe Analytics, de redes sociales, CRMs, etc., para recopilar datos sobre el comportamiento del usuario, el rendimiento de las campa√±as, el tr√°fico del sitio web, las interacciones sociales, etc.
An√°lisis de Datos: Examinar grandes vol√∫menes de datos para identificar tendencias, patrones, oportunidades y problemas. Esto implica la creaci√≥n de informes, dashboards y la realizaci√≥n de an√°lisis en profundidad.
Monitorizaci√≥n del Rendimiento: Hacer un seguimiento del rendimiento de sitios web, aplicaciones, campa√±as de marketing digital (SEO, SEM, redes sociales, e-mail marketing, etc.) y otras iniciativas digitales.
Identificaci√≥n de Insights: Transformar datos brutos en insights accionables que puedan guiar la toma de decisiones estrat√©gicas para mejorar el ROI (Retorno de la Inversi√≥n).
Optimizaci√≥n: Proponer e implementar mejoras basadas en datos, como la optimizaci√≥n de los embudos de conversi√≥n, la personalizaci√≥n de contenido, mejoras en la experiencia de usuario (UX), etc.
Pruebas A/B y Optimizaci√≥n de la Tasa de Conversi√≥n (CRO): Realizar pruebas controladas para comparar diferentes versiones de p√°ginas, anuncios o elementos de dise√±o y determinar cu√°l tiene un mejor rendimiento.
Generaci√≥n de Informes: Presentar los resultados de los an√°lisis de forma clara y comprensible para diferentes stakeholders, incluyendo los equipos de marketing, ventas, producto y direcci√≥n.
Investigaci√≥n de Mercados: Ayudar a entender el comportamiento del consumidor online, las tendencias del mercado y el an√°lisis de la competencia en el entorno digital.



Requisitos:


Conocimientos de Marketing Digital: SEO, SEM, redes sociales, e-mail marketing, marketing de contenidos.
Capacidad Anal√≠tica: Habilidad para pensar de forma cr√≠tica, identificar problemas y proponer soluciones basadas en datos.
Estad√≠stica B√°sica: Comprensi√≥n de conceptos estad√≠sticos para validar an√°lisis y pruebas.
Visualizaci√≥n de Datos: Capacidad de crear gr√°ficos y dashboards que cuenten una historia con los datos (ej: Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio - anteriormente Google Data Studio).
Dominio de Hojas de C√°lculo: Excel/Google Sheets a nivel avanzado.
Habilidades de Comunicaci√≥n: Capacidad para presentar resultados complejos de forma simple e impactante.
Nociones de UX/UI: Entender c√≥mo la experiencia de usuario afecta al rendimiento digital.
SQL (Valorable): Para manipular y extraer datos de bases de datos.
Python/R: Para an√°lisis m√°s avanzados y automatizaci√≥n.
Imprescindible dominio del catal√°n.

Title: Junior Supply Chain Data Analyst - September 2025
Description:
Job Description

About the role

Kickstart your data consulting career!

In your role as a Junior Supply Chain Data Analyst, you work on global transformation and optimizing projects in Supply Chain. You contribute to successful project outcomes by focusing on the end-to-end data analyst roadmap, including data querying, data quality review, data analysis, dashboarding, and communication with client business and IT teams.

But before starting in one of our running projects, you will have a spot in our supply chain training bootcamp in September 2025 in Belgium! You‚Äôll sharpen your consulting expertise alongside fellow new starters from around the globe. In just three exciting weeks, our immersive training program covers everything from essential soft skills to advanced supply chain management to becoming a kick-ass Supply Chain Data Analyst!

What can you do at Bluecrux?


You'll start immediately in a visible, autonomous role as a project member in one of our running planning transformation projects in industries such as life sciences, chemicals, food and beverages, and manufacturing.
You will be part of a project team that is a mix of internal colleagues, supply chain planners, IT teams and managers from the client side, and you'll be doing stuff like this:
Work with data: Collect, clean and analyze data to support better decisions. You help build dashboards and transform raw data into insights.
Support master data processes: Help structure and maintain key supply chain data with the team.
Connect systems: Learn how systems like ERP, APS and WMS interact, and help streamline data flows between them.
Document & align: Assist in documenting processes, drafting data policies, and keeping stakeholders aligned.
Contribute to projects: Be involved in data migrations, process improvements and supporting workshops.
Grow your skills: Get hands-on experience with data warehousing, modeling, and integration tools.

Job requirements

About You


You'll graduate in 2025 and want to start your career in September 2025.
You see yourself thriving in the world of value chain transformation and are interested in how Technology, Business Processes, Data Analytics, and Change management create a flourishing ecosystem of solutions.
Above all, we believe in your potential:
You can demonstrate profound logical reasoning and you are resourceful in detailing solutions and considerate about their consequences.
You're a team worker and player who can perform well without much supervision and who is committed to your own objectives.
You're open to feedback and always look for ways to enhance collaboration.
You like to be challenged daily, show proactive ownership, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
You feel connected with and are ready to represent our company values: dig deep, own it, come together move fast and be kind!


Some hard skills:
You have that interest in Supply chain Processes and Data Analytics. Ideally, you have had an introduction to Supply chain processes in a minor or major within master‚Äôs degrees like business engineering, civil engineering ‚Äì operational research/ data analytics or applied economics.
We consider any experience or proficiency in dashboard creation tools, such as PowerBI, Tableau, etc. a plus.
You are fluent in English and preferably Spanish. Mastery of any other language is a definite plus.
Willingness and eligibility to travel in and outside the EU and to work in a hybrid working model.

Why join us?


Well, a kickstart to your career through a 3-week training program, our Supply Chain boot camp in September in Belgium. You will learn the ins & outs of Supply Chain Management: Demand Planning, S&OP and Financial Planning, Supply Planning, Inventory Management, Master Data Management, Supply Chain Modeling and Planning Tools. This will allow you to onboard into our projects with a backpack full of expertise & skills!
Join a company at the forefront of global supply chain transformation with a new office in Barcelona ‚Äî be part of this exciting expansion!
Leverage your expertise in a pioneering role, with the full support of our international team of experts to drive Barcelona‚Äôs success.
Be part of a global network spanning Belgium, the USA, Switzerland, Ireland, the Netherlands, Australia and Singapore‚Äîworking on impactful international projects.
Travel opportunities to client sites, making your work truly international and engaging across borders.
Enjoy a workplace where personal and professional growth is prioritized‚Äîadvance your career at your own pace.
We celebrate individuality, allowing you to thrive by being uniquely yourself.
Benefit from a competitive salary package, complete with multiple extra-legal perks designed to reward your expertise.


About Us

At Bluecrux, we transform supply chains into smart, efficient value chains through a blend of expert consulting and cutting-edge technology. We collaborate closely with industry leaders like Johnson & Johnson, GSK, Bridgestone, AkzoNobel, Beiersdorf, Oatly, and many more ‚Äì creating partnerships that drive meaningful impact. With a global presence in Europe, the US and APAC, we're committed to shaping the future of value chains, one success story at a time.

Within the plan squad, we have built up specific expertise in three main areas: Life sciences/pharma, CPG&CH and Chemicals&Industries. In these industries, we support a range of global leaders in their E2E planning transformation journey such as Bayer, Johnson&Johnson, BASF and Bridgestone.

During these E2E supply chain planning transformations, our experts support our customers in every step of their journey. We partner up to define a vision and review the operating model to create a strong and agile basis for the future.

The PLAN squad designs & implements our customers‚Äô business transformation by defining the future organizational operating model, designing new ways of working & solutions advanced planning systems (APS), feeding their data factory, accelerating their setup towards agile S&OP or guiding them through their end-to-end supply chain planning. We do not work for them but rather with them, and we stand by their side the entire time. That is the only way to make changes stick and flourish.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Analyst, Operational Analytics

Summary: The Senior Analyst will play a pivotal role within Business Analytics function under ESI Business Excellence and Transformation, driving operational excellence and supporting strategic initiatives through insightful analytics and project collaboration. This role will primarily focus on analyzing transactional data of customer interactions, file exchange, and will strategically support our system migration. Additionally, this role offers the opportunity to broaden analytical expertise across multiple systems and organizational datasets, facilitating comprehensive insights and informed business decisions

Key Responsibilities


Conduct detailed analyses of customer interactions including calls, services tickets and file attachments to identify patterns, trends and operational improvement opportunities
Provide insights to address leadership inquiries, support corporate initiatives, and collaborate with business units for targeted investigation
Perform studies by consolidating data from various sources to identify relationship and predictive factors among dataset, offering actionable insights to stakeholders
Support the design and implementation of analytics processes and framework;
Support data rationalization effort to ensure efficient migration and minimize redundant data
Partner with cross-functional project teams, providing analytical support and ensure data-driven decisions aligned with project objectives
Actively contribute to strategic initiative, assisting leadership in operationalizing analytics insights
Develop clear, compelling visualization and reports tailored to varied audiences, effectively communicating insights and recommendation
Engage with stakeholders across the organization, ensuring alignment and understanding of analytics outcomes


Qualification


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business analytics, data science, information technology or a related field required; Master‚Äôs degree preferred
Minimum of 4-6 years of professional experiences in analytics roles, preferably within operational analytics or project support
Hands on experience with CRM analytics; Oracle, Salesforce experiences preferred
Proficiency in analytical tools and languages such as SQL, Python, Tableau, Power BI or similar
Experience with analyzing unstructured data and text analytics techniques (natural language processing, text mining) is highly desirable
Strong analytical skills with the capability to interpret complex data and translate insights into actionable recommendations
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Ability to work in fast paced, cross functional, and global environments
Curious and willing to learn about the business process behind of the data; Enthusiastic about continuous learning and analytical innovation


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP‚Äôs operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP‚Äôs culture and our full set of values.

Title: Consultant - Digital Analytics (m/w/d) for Barcelona
Description:
Digitl is a young and innovative company in the field of marketing and cloud technology. In a collaborative and cross-functional environment, we develop new concepts to lead our customers from a wide range of industries into a digitally-driven future. Be part of it, and bring in your own fresh and forward-looking ideas as a Consultant in Digital Analytics to implement them with experts from your team or with Google as a direct contact.


Tasks



As a Consultant Digital Analytics you will develop innovative concepts for the collection and activation of app and website data for our customers


You will take on the role of project manager on the agency side, independently conduct workshops and help with support requests with your expertise


You will work across disciplines with our Data Science, Cloud and AdTech teams to develop new technologies in the areas of machine learning, data governance, data privacy, etc


You are up to date on the latest trends and developments and are happy to share your knowledge



Qualifications



Successfully completed studies or training (e.g. in the field of business administration, marketing, or digital media)


Professional experience in the field of digital analytics


Experience with leading digital analytics tools (ideally Google Analytics, but Adobe Analytics, Webtrekk and other tracking tools are also an advantage) (GAIQ desirable)


Experience in project and/or account management


Clear communication both verbally and in writing - in fluent English, German speaker is a plus


We love Team players



Perks & Benefits



Co-Working - you have a place in the best co-working spaces in D√ºsseldorf, Zurich, Barcelona or Hamburg at your disposal.


Remote 1st - all our processes are designed for decentralized working. You decide whether you prefer to work in your home office or spend your day from one of our offices


Home Office Equipment - we provide you with a standard for your remote working environment


Animal Lovers - If you have a dog, you can bring it to any of our offices


Skill Building - As a highly specialized technology partner, we support your development with certificates, conference attendance and training

  • Successfully completed studies or training (e.g. in the field of business administration, marketing, or digital media)

  • Professional experience in the field of digital analytics

  • Experience with leading digital analytics tools (ideally Google Analytics, but Adobe Analytics, Webtrekk and other tracking tools are also an advantage) (GAIQ desirable)

  • Experience in project and/or account management

  • Clear communication both verbally and in writing - in fluent English, German speaker is a plus

  • We love Team players


Perks & Benefits

  • Co-Working - you have a place in the best co-working spaces in D√ºsseldorf, Zurich, Barcelona or Hamburg at your disposal.

  • Remote 1st - all our processes are designed for decentralized working. You decide whether you prefer to work in your home office or spend your day from one of our offices

  • Home Office Equipment - we provide you with a standard for your remote working environment

  • Animal Lovers - If you have a dog, you can bring it to any of our offices

  • Skill Building - As a highly specialized technology partner, we support your development with certificates, conference attendance and training

Title: Data Annotator
Description:
What if your next role let you shape the future of AI‚Äîand do it with empathy, responsibility, and real-world impact? One of the biggest challenges and opportunities with artificial intelligence is around the data used to train AI models, and how to do that responsibly and ethically whilst governing data protection, applying AI regulations, democratize knowledge and balance individual rights with societal benefits.

As a Machine Learning Data Curator in Project Hafnia, you will be responsible for the annotations of visual data used in computer vision model training. This will cover some manual labializations, review, quality assessment, definition and application of standards. We would love for you to contribute to the automation of annotations while keeping the same quality. Your effort in data preparation will be critical to maintain the right quality level and ensure the highest data protection level for our project. You will collaborate with a cross-functional team to drive data quality, ensuring best practices and compliance with industry standards.

You will join our innovative and entrepreneurial development team at Milestone global leader in data-driven video management solutions.¬†Our mission is to build a suite of services surrounding a responsible data library as its core, leveraging compliant, high-quality and ethically sourced video data. To achieve that, we follow our long-term strategy, continuously scrutinize the emerging AI and stick to our ethical tech and responsible use of technology agenda.

Your owned perimeter:

As a Machine Learning data curator, you will be responsibilities for:


Annotate video and image data ‚Äì for various classes, segmentations, bounding boxes, distributions, captions etc.
Review the quality of annotations
Help define and improve annotation standards
Contribute to the continuous evolving Hafnia ontology
Document the annotation process and decision in classes
Support and contribute to annotation automation and strategy
Where skill meets impact!

You might be the person we are looking for if you bring curiosity and craft and if you truly care about data preparation and have a deep understanding of data curation. Key qualifications include:

Dream Technical Skills:


Attention to details¬†
Good concentration capabilities
Be fast at the bounding box
Be open
Good requirements understanding
Pitch in optimal path to data preparation


Expected Experience or Equivalent:


None (previous annotation experience is a nice to have).


About project Hafnia and our team:

You will join about 25 fantastic colleagues in a fast-growing and broadly international team that besides the engineering core counts profiles across go-to-market, community, compliance, strategy and more. We operate as an autonomous product team and share an entrepreneurial mindset and a firm belief that we can cover new grounds to the benefit of the world. We work with trust, collaboration and flexibility as our foundations.¬†

What else can Milestone offer you:

In addition to the exciting challenges of this role, Milestone provides:


Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A supportive company culture and inclusive workplace environment.
Daily meals, snacks, and beverages in our canteen.
Office amenities such as company bikes, a gym, massages, and Friday gatherings.
Monthly company events for team bonding and enjoyment.


Location, application and contact:

Ideally, your base will be within regular travelling distance of our HQ in Copenhagen or our Madrid office but if you are the right profile, other options are possible.

We would like to receive your CV in English, avoid pictures; and cover letter won‚Äôt even be read. If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact our Engineering Manager, Fulgencio Navarro (+34 662024273)

We would like you to start as soon as possible, and we will hire on an ongoing basis as we interview candidates.

Join us in shaping the future of video management through engineering and innovation. Let‚Äôs build products, services and your career in a meaningful way together!

A few more info about Milestone - help us make the world see:

You will join Milestone, international company in rapid growth with development sites in Denmark, Bulgaria and Spain ‚Äì and offices all over the world. We are technology driven as we are developing and maintaining one of the most advanced video surveillance systems in the world. Innovation is not only important for us. It is a part of our DNA just as responsible use of technology which we actively support. We believe in trust, mutual respect, a healthy work life balance and room for all voices to be acknowledged. As such, we expect you to engage, speak up, and make a difference for our customers, your colleagues and yourself. Read more at milestonesys.com

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
This job is with Criteo, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

What You'll Do

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Responsibilities

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).


Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we'd love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world's marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data & Analytics Strategist
Description:
Omega CRM is a Merkle & Dentsu company, leader in development of Customer Experience services, with +20 years of experience in the use of Technology applied to Marketing and providing a unique Customer Relationship with mainly focus on Innovation is looking for a Data & Analytics Strategist

Responsibilities


Gains industry and market expertise by participating in various projects to provide clients with a "benchmark" perspective.
Possesses a comprehensive understanding of the Analytics sector and the industry, contributing to business objectives by developing new products and services aligned with client needs.
Analyzes, estimates, and develops proposals to support the commercial team. Identifies when specialists from other service lines or knowledge areas are needed to enhance client advisory.
Implements mechanisms to identify and control commercial risks during the pre-sales phase.
Analyzes and interprets risks before project initiation and communicates them to Operations.
Directly engages in delivering services for highly complex and high-risk projects, in coordination with Operations.
Develops new methodologies within their field of responsibility to impact the work of others and improve area outcomes.
Evaluates implementation results against the proposed solution, assessing efficiency and customer satisfaction.


Acts as a role model for the team, managing their development as a People Lead:


Establishes and implements a communication strategy to clearly define team objectives.
Develops and manages talent within the team, leveraging tools to enhance people and organizational goals.
Conducts logical analyses, identifies issues, seeks and interprets relevant information to share and coordinate data within the team, and helps remove obstacles to progress.
Supports, encourages, and motivates team members to foster commitment to the organization and area objectives.
Listens to team members, gathers their professional and personal needs, and collaborates with HR to facilitate career development.
Participates in decision-making regarding professional development, evaluation, and team performance.


Qualifications & Skills


Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent vocational training).
Strong foundation in platform development, organization, time management, conflict resolution, prioritization, methodologies, and English proficiency.
Extensive experience in business data collection, interpretation, and process optimization.
At least 5 years of experience in a similar role (Project Manager / Solution Architect).
Proficiency in software tools related to the core technologies of the implemented applications.
Collaboration with business units and technology teams to enhance services, environments, and customer experience.
Data Engineering & Cloud: Talend, Pentaho, Datorama, SQL, Python.
Analytics & BI: Tableau, Power BI, Salesforce CRM Analytics, Grafana.
Languages: English proficiency.


What Do We Offer


Permanent contract.
Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life.
Certifications plan. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners.
Home Office. You decide and we support you.
Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurtant, ‚Ä¶).
Health insurance.
OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention
Professional development: Evolve, grow and get where you want to go.


About Us

Omega CRM, a Merkle Company, is a global digital company specialising in accelerating the Business Experience (BX) of our clients through customer-centric solutions, technology, and data ‚Äì all enhanced by AI.

Together with Merkle, we form the largest Customer Experience Management (CXM) agency in Spain, and as part of the dentsu group, we offer end-to-end solutions that integrate media, creativity, content, technology, and strategy to deliver real business impact.

With over 23 years of experience, a team of 580+ professionals from 24 nationalities, and 2,500+ certifications, Omega CRM is a recognised leader in the Salesforce ecosystem in Spain.

We operate across key industries including Retail, Healthcare, Pharma, Real Estate, Education, and Non-Profit, delivering omnichannel experiences in Customer Service, eCommerce, Marketing, and Analytics.

Client satisfaction is at our core (rating: 4.9/5), and we‚Äôve been recognised with awards such as Salesforce Partner of the Year FY23 and Most Innovative Project (Iberia).

At Omega CRM, we believe in growth through people ‚Äì guided by our values: #Talent, #Flexibility, #Commitment, and #Innovation. We grow #Together.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Grow & Engage
Description:
We are seeking an organised and self-motivated Senior Data Analyst to work embedded in our Grow & Engage domain, one of our cross-functional areas to help shape the development of one of the world's leading FinTech products. In this role, you will also have the opportunity to lead, mentor, and coach other analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning within the team.

About The Opportunity

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Product & Business Segments (Acquire, Memberships and Engagement) in the Growth and Engage domain to make data-driven decisions. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, designers, and product managers.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiatives‚Äô scope.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
Handle stakeholders: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
Evaluate initiatives: Support Product experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our product and business teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.
Lead, mentor, and coach other analysts, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team environment.
Support some of the following product & business team initiatives (not limited to):
You support your team in discovery of new product ideas, identifying user friction points and business opportunities.
Evaluate your teams‚Äô continuous releases making sure they are delivering on business goals via experimental or observational methods.
Collaborate with UX researchers to combine qualitative and quantitative research for better product hypotheses.
During product development you make sure all data needed for future evaluation is being captured through set up of tracking events or as part of the backend service.
Drive the quantitative analysis on your segment, being responsible for the insights and business discovery on the team.

Background

What you need to be successful:

4+ years of relevant experience, ideally within the Product or Analytics field.

Skills


Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.
Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)
Good presentation skills and communication skills.
Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like acquisition, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
Having experience in fintech would be a plus.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe‚Äôs most talked about disruptors üöÄ.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
Come together with your team in the office for a dedicated day of teamwork each week, plus another day of your choice, and enjoy the flexibility of remote work the rest of the time. Some roles may require additional in-office presence.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today‚Äôs digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it‚Äôs how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

Equal Opportunities

We recognize that our strength lies in our people and the varied perspectives they bring to our workforce. We strive to build talented and diverse teams to drive our business success and empower our people to reach their full potential.

We genuinely welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, cultures, genders, sexual orientations, abilities, neurodiversities, and ages. We're committed to creating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued and respected, free from harassment and discrimination. If there's anything you need to make the application process work for you, please let us know by reaching out to candidate.exp@n26.com.

Visit our website to learn more about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at N26.
Show more

    • During product development you make sure all data needed for future evaluation is being captured through set up of tracking events or as part of the backend service.
    • Drive the quantitative analysis on your segment, being responsible for the insights and business discovery on the team.
Background

What you need to be successful:

4+ years of relevant experience, ideally within the Product or Analytics field.

Skills

  • Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.
  • Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
  • Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)
  • Good presentation skills and communication skills.
  • Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like acquisition, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
  • Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
  • Having experience in fintech would be a plus.

What‚Äôs In It For You

  • Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe‚Äôs most talked about disruptors üöÄ.
  • Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
  • Come together with your team in the office for a dedicated day of teamwork each week, plus another day of your choice, and enjoy the flexibility of remote work the rest of the time. Some roles may require additional in-office presence.
  • As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
  • Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
  • A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
  • A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.

Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today‚Äôs digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it‚Äôs how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

Equal Opportunities

We recognize that our strength lies in our people and the varied perspectives they bring to our workforce. We strive to build talented and diverse teams to drive our business success and empower our people to reach their full potential.

We genuinely welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, cultures, genders, sexual orientations, abilities, neurodiversities, and ages. We're committed to creating an inclusive workspace where everyone feels valued and respected, free from harassment and discrimination. If there's anything you need to make the application process work for you, please let us know by reaching out to candidate.exp@n26.com.

Visit our website to learn more about Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at N26.

Title: Business Analyst (Reporting & Analytics)
Description:
Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Our opportunity

Are you passionate about data, processes and analytics, someone who wants to be part of an innovative and motivated team and help us make the difference? Then this is your opportunity within one of the world‚Äôs leading insurance groups!

In this role of a Business Analyst, you will be part of the global ‚ÄúReporting and Analytics‚Äù team within Group Investment Management. You will collaborate closely with business users in different countries and translate analytical and reporting needs into functional requirements and solutions. You will analyse interrelationships of business processes, complex data and financial systems, define IT specifications and implement reporting front-end solution for our global end user base.

Your role

As a Business Analyst (Reporting & Analytics) your main responsibilities will involve:


Develop analytical, regulatory, and operational reports and dashboards using business intelligence tools, as well as adapting them according to business needs and changes in regulation
Ensure the good quality of the data across our reporting tools with the performance of proper control checks and analysis of the results
Analysis of reporting & analytics business requirements and translation into functional and technical solution specifications
Lead and support initiatives and projects related to new or existing business intelligence solutions
Perform impact analysis of application holding an end-to-end view of the system
Continuous improvement of existing reporting processes, services and infrastructure
Provide end-user support/training for reporting needs
Ensure compliance and governance
Collaborate with our main stakeholders (Investment Management, Finance Teams) to identify reporting needs
Analyze Investments data and provide insights into the results.


Your role will involve building relationships with:


Stakeholders on local, regional and group levels
Investment back-office and middle-office teams
Market and Master Data teams
IT teams


Your Skills And Experience

As Business Analyst (Reporting & Analytics) your education and personal skills will ideally include:

Education:


Bachelor or Master¬¥s degree in either Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Information Technology and/or quantitative fields such as Statistics and Math with good academic records
Understanding of financial products, financial markets as well as the main accounting principles (IFRS, GAAPs)
Fluent in written and spoken English
CFA/CPA/CMA/ACCA certification is a plus


Technical skills:


3-4 Years of proven experience with financial data analysis and business analytics, preferably in the financial services or insurance industry
Business Analyst skills (e.g., analytical skills, requirement engineering, design thinking, agile methodologies)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Coding skills (preferably SQL, Python, Spark)
Familiarity with ERP system SAP BW, FAM/TRM or FICO is a plus
Data management (e.g., quality checks, modelling, data warehousing, governance) is a plus
Experience with data visualization and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau or QlikView) would be considered an asset


Personal skills:


Ability to work with multi-cultural project teams and facilitating workshops with stakeholders
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Creative thinking and intellectual curiosity
Ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines with attention to detail.
Good self-management skills and stress resilience


What we offer?

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer:


Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance
Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs
Ticket restaurant or flexibility to exchange it for other benefits
Life, accident, and Health Insurance
Collective Life Retirement Plan
2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you
Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts
Functional diversity benefits
No dress code


Primary work location is Barcelona, Via Augusta. Please apply with your CV in English.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet.


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Hybrid
Schedule: Full Time

Title: BI Business Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Proactively identify and collect analytical, tooling and reporting needs from different stakeholders ‚Äì Finance, Sales Operations, FP&A,...
Support, develop and maintain self-service automated reporting for multiple teams across the organization using Power BI, Python or any other relevant technologies
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders (especially IIT) to continuously improve customer centricity, enhance user functionality and maximize reporting outputs
Stay up-to-date with the latest BI tools and technologies, and make recommendations for new tools and approaches that could improve our BI capabilities
Monitor and maintain current reporting processes & data integrity that are relying on data from different systems and platforms
Incorporate feature requests or new tools into product roadmap based on leadership / end users business needs in order to optimize our processes
Provide support on a daily basis to finance & business teams on any issues/blockers they might face
Coordinate training to end users on new reporting tools, processes and best practices
Develop strong project management skills to support our growth and organizational changes



Who You Are:


4-5 years of experience working within BI, Data analytics or finance
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science etc.) or in Business, Finance with equivalent practical experience
SQL proficiency is required
Experience working with Power BI
Background in any of the following is a plus: Python, Tableau, Databricks, Vertica, Hive/Hadoop, MS SQL Studio
Previous Databricks experience is a big plus
Keen intellectual curiosity and ability to structure & solve complex problems in an autonomous way
Exceptional attention to detail coupled with an ability to see the big picture
Thorough conceptual and practical understanding of relational databases, data architecture/governance, and real-world application of statistical concepts
Combining technical skills, passion for learning and the ability to interact with a diverse group of stakeholders in a dynamic environment
Excellent communication skills in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Entry Specialist
Description:
```html




About the Role:

This role entails data entry of a high volume of invoice entries.
The ideal candidate will be able to work both independently and collaboratively within a team, as well as having daily interaction with internal and external stakeholders.
The position is fast-paced and requires the ability to work both quickly and accurately.







Schedule & Work Environment:







Onsite the 1st day, then mostly remote with occasional meetings onsite.
Flexible with scheduling/hours if needed.










Responsibilities:







Accurately and efficiently enter invoices on a daily basis
Manage workload to meet Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Identify and resolve issues promptly and proactively
Research and resolve vendor payment discrepancies and related issues
Meet deadlines and maintain workflow
Review invoices for correct approval, G/L coding, accuracy, and compliance to corporate policies
Interact professionally with international, domestic, and foreign vendors, as well as corporate stakeholders
Build and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders




Required Skills:







Typing speed of 60+ words per minute
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain productive working relationships
Capable of working both independently and collaboratively in a team environment




Equal Opportunity Statement: We are committed to diversity and inclusivity.




```

Title: Entry Level Data Relationship Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

R.W. Mercer Co. is seeking a Remote Data Relationship Analyst to identify, analyze, and manage relationships between data entities across systems and business domains. The role involves collaborating with various teams to ensure data accuracy and facilitate high-quality decision-making.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Analyze data structures and define entity relationships across platforms (e.g., customer, product, transaction, vendor, or compliance data)

‚Ä¢ Create and maintain data dictionaries, ERDs (entity relationship diagrams), and metadata documentation

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and business users to ensure accurate and consistent relationships between datasets

‚Ä¢ Map data flows and dependencies across systems and databases (e.g., ERP, CRM, data warehouse, cloud platforms)

‚Ä¢ Support data governance efforts by defining and enforcing relationship integrity rules (e.g., referential integrity, cardinality)

‚Ä¢ Participate in master data management (MDM), data lineage tracking, and data quality initiatives

‚Ä¢ Conduct impact analyses when data structures change or when new systems are introduced

‚Ä¢ Facilitate data integration and transformation logic for reporting and analytics use cases

‚Ä¢ Recommend improvements to data models and reporting structures to enhance relational consistency

‚Ä¢ Ensure documentation is up-to-date, accessible, and aligned with organizational data governance standards




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or related field

‚Ä¢ 2 years of experience in data analysis, data modeling, or business systems analysis

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in SQL and experience querying relational databases (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL)

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of data relationships, primary/foreign keys, joins, normalization, and dimensional modeling

‚Ä¢ Experience with data visualization or mapping tools (e.g., ER/Studio, Lucidchart, dbt, Power BI, Tableau)

‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical, communication, and documentation skills

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working remotely with cross-functional, distributed teams




Company:

R.W.

Title: Data Engineer - Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

Afresh is on a mission to eliminate food waste and make fresh food accessible to all. They are seeking a Data Engineer to help shape how customer data flows through their platform, improving data ingestion, transformation, and operationalization to drive down food waste for grocery chains.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Build and maintain robust data pipelines that ingest, transform, and validate complex customer data using PySpark, Python, and dbt to process billions of records from customer datasets, ensuring data is accurate, reliable, and ready for downstream use.

‚Ä¢ Help improve integrations with new customers, making the process faster and more repeatable through thoughtful tooling.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the adoption of cutting-edge AI tooling (e.g., LLM-assisted data cleaning, semantic validation, and anomaly detection).

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with product, engineering, and go-to-market teams to design and deliver data solutions for new products and features.

‚Ä¢ Identify and implement optimizations to improve ETL runtime and data processing scalability, reducing the time and effort required for integrations.

‚Ä¢ Solve real-world data quality challenges by working directly with messy, incomplete, or inconsistent customer data to extract the signal we need.

‚Ä¢ Learn and grow by pairing with other engineers, participating in design reviews, and taking on bigger and bigger projects.




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience building ETLs or data workflows with Python, PySpark, SQL, or similar tools.

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with messy, incomplete, or inconsistent datasets‚Äîand turning them into something structured and usable.

‚Ä¢ Experience in identifying areas where tooling or automation can simplify workflows and reduce manual effort.

‚Ä¢ Experience or strong interest in platforms like Databricks, Snowflake, and dbt.

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work with ambiguous or incomplete requirements to deliver concrete, impactful solutions.

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail and pride in delivering robust, maintainable solutions.

‚Ä¢ Collaborative and communicative ‚Äî you work well across teams and aren't afraid to ask questions.

‚Ä¢ Learning mindset ‚Äî hungry to grow your skills and move fast.




Company:

Afresh is an AI-powered company selling software to track demand and manage orders for fresh produce in grocery stores. Afresh has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Show more

‚Ä¢ Identify and implement optimizations to improve ETL runtime and data processing scalability, reducing the time and effort required for integrations.

Title: Data Analytics Associate (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

CBRE is a leading global real estate services firm, and they are seeking a Data Analytics Associate to provide analytical support through data collection, management, and analysis. The role involves analyzing data to improve effectiveness and predict outcomes to develop actionable business intelligence.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Responsible for data collection, input, aggregation, and data auditing.

‚Ä¢ Support accurate key metric reporting and data review performed by the organization.

‚Ä¢ Review the accuracy of information provided and respond to requests from management and vendors.

‚Ä¢ Assist in generating basic reports and data dashboards and associated assets including scripts, tables, workflows, and supporting processes in accordance with team standards

‚Ä¢ Use SQL and other scripting languages to develop and maintain queries that pull and curate data from multiple sources

‚Ä¢ Create ad-hoc presentations and assess development for review. Respond to information requests in a timely manner.

‚Ä¢ Gather and analyze data to identify and solve complex problems that arise with little or no precedent.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the agile development team to provide recommendations and communications on enhancing existing or new processes and programs.

‚Ä¢ Suggest improvements to existing processes and solutions to improve the efficiency of the team.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain data models, data automation systems, low-code solutions, dashboards, and performance metrics support.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support.

‚Ä¢ Lead by example and model behaviors that are consistent with CBRE RISE values.
