Title: Data Engineer I (Entry Level)
Description:
UF Information Technology (UFIT) is currently seeking an entry-level Data Engineer I to join Data Platform and Analytics ‚Äì Data Engineering. This role involves implementing data pipelines, optimizing data structures, and collaborating closely with customers and team members to deliver high-quality technical solutions.




Responsibilities

Duties are related to data design, data accuracy, data replication, data transformation, metadata, and repository creation for the data hub, which contain data repositories for all the information systems managed by UFIT.
Troubleshoot and performance tune existing data pipelines and integrations. Make recommendations toward the development of new code or reuse/enhancement of existing code. Review processes that audit data synchronization for data corrections.
Assist in the development, maintenance, and support of the data hub and corresponding data marts, including the development of near real-time and batched data marts, star schema design, integrations, operational reporting data marts, debugging and modifying program code, managing deadlines, and ensuring quality control practices are followed.




Qualification




Required

Associate's degree; or a high school diploma or equivalent and two years of relevant experience.
Appropriate college coursework or vocational/technical training may substitute at an equivalent rate for the required experience, but does not negate the minimum degree requirements.




Preferred

Understanding of data pipeline and data integration methodologies
Understanding of database functionality
Understanding of object-based storage
Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations
Knowledge of methods and ability to grasp new concepts, acquire new ways of seeing things, and revise ways of thinking and behaving, with the understanding that this is an ongoing business necessity.

Title: Data Engineer, Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

Afresh is on a mission to eliminate food waste and make fresh food accessible to all. They are seeking a Data Engineer to help shape how customer data flows through their platform, improving data ingestion, transformation, and operationalization to drive down food waste for grocery chains.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Build and maintain robust data pipelines that ingest, transform, and validate complex customer data using PySpark, Python, and dbt to process billions of records from customer datasets, ensuring data is accurate, reliable, and ready for downstream use.

‚Ä¢ Help improve integrations with new customers, making the process faster and more repeatable through thoughtful tooling.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the adoption of cutting-edge AI tooling (e.g., LLM-assisted data cleaning, semantic validation, and anomaly detection).

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with product, engineering, and go-to-market teams to design and deliver data solutions for new products and features.

‚Ä¢ Identify and implement optimizations to improve ETL runtime and data processing scalability, reducing the time and effort required for integrations.

‚Ä¢ Solve real-world data quality challenges by working directly with messy, incomplete, or inconsistent customer data to extract the signal we need.

‚Ä¢ Learn and grow by pairing with other engineers, participating in design reviews, and taking on bigger and bigger projects.




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience building ETLs or data workflows with Python, PySpark, SQL, or similar tools.

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with messy, incomplete, or inconsistent datasets‚Äîand turning them into something structured and usable.

‚Ä¢ Experience in identifying areas where tooling or automation can simplify workflows and reduce manual effort.

‚Ä¢ Experience or strong interest in platforms like Databricks, Snowflake, and dbt.

‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work with ambiguous or incomplete requirements to deliver concrete, impactful solutions.

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail and pride in delivering robust, maintainable solutions.

‚Ä¢ Collaborative and communicative ‚Äî you work well across teams and aren't afraid to ask questions.

‚Ä¢ Learning mindset ‚Äî hungry to grow your skills and move fast.




Company:

Afresh is an AI-powered company selling software to track demand and manage orders for fresh produce in grocery stores. Afresh has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Entry Level Data Specialist
Description:
Leidos is a Fortune 500¬Æ innovation company rapidly addressing the world‚Äôs most vexing challenges in national security and health. They are seeking a Data Collection Specialist II to support the DISA Global Operations Center by applying statistical methods to collect and interpret data for operational support.




Responsibilities

Monitor and report on contractual performance standards and trouble ticket lifecycle management for a 24/7 Operations Center.
Collaborate within the Data Collection Services team to ensure functional processes and procedures are monitored and adhered to.
Work under moderate supervision to ensure efficiency by analyzing and identifying areas of improvement and then assisting with the development of process changes that enable the team to attain integrated outcomes that are effective.
Support business practices by ensuring ticket queues are monitored, updated, and analyzed to validate that the next actions are clear and concise to ensure contract performance goals are met.
Receive ad-hoc requests from team leads and provide timely responses back to requestor
Utilize report data to identify and recommend correction on routine problems and issues.




Qualification




Required

Currently possess an active Secret security clearance.
Basic understanding of IT ticketing processes, applications and Data Analytics.
High school diploma and 1-3 years of experience.

Title: Entry Level Remote Data Management Assistant
Description:
Job_Summary:

Flourish Research is a fast-growing research organization dedicated to providing innovative and reliable data solutions. They are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Remote Data Management Assistant to collect, clean, and manage data, ensuring accuracy and supporting research projects.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Work closely with the research team to collect, clean, and manage large sets of data from various sources

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain data entry protocols and quality control procedures

‚Ä¢ Ensure the accuracy and completeness of all data collected and entered into databases

‚Ä¢ Organize and maintain electronic and physical records of data and research materials

‚Ä¢ Conduct regular data audits to identify and resolve discrepancies or errors

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with team members to ensure timely and accurate data reporting

‚Ä¢ Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data management techniques

‚Ä¢ Provide support for data analysis and interpretation as needed

-Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in a related field such as data management, statistics, or computer science

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of data management principles and techniques

‚Ä¢ Proficient in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis tools

‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational and time-management skills

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and in a team environment

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail and accuracy is a must

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal




-Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Previous experience in data management or a related field is preferred




Company:

Flourish Research is a pharmaceutical company that simplifies clinical trials.

Title: GIS Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Veolia in North America is the top-ranked environmental company in the United States for three consecutive years, and the country's largest private water operator and technology provider as well as hazardous waste and pollution treatment leader. It offers a full spectrum of water, waste, and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. Veolia helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Veolia has more than 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across North America.

Job Description

Position Purpose:

This position will be responsible for developing, operating, and maintaining all components of the Mid-Atlantic Geographic Information System (GIS). This position supports all operations by keeping the Enterprise GIS system current, supporting staff that use GIS and GPS equipment, and providing training. Responsible for ensuring all GIS data adheres to data standards and best practices. This position will provide support publishing GIS data for enhanced mapping, operational support, engineering projects, creation and delivery of presentations, and participate in internal meetings. Responsible for collecting and maintaining GPS data for the business unit.

Primary Duties/Responsibilities


Assist in the development and maintenance of the GIS including updating geometry and attributes to reflect system updates.
Conduct field data collection as needed.
Work independently and in a collaborative team driven environment.
Train and support field staff and contractors on mobile devices, GIS maps and GPS technology.
Update GIS data using information provided by GPS data collection and in EAM/WFM systems such as CityWorks, INFOR, or KloudGin.
Adhere to standards for GIS systems, including but not limited to databases, applications, and training programs.
Create and maintain Enterprise Portal/AGOL maps and applications to support operational needs and reporting to leadership.
Enhance and promote the utilization of GIS within the business unit.
Assist in readiness activities for Esri Utility Network Implementation.


Work Environment


Ability to split time between office work and medium-duty field work such as GPS data collection outdoors for several hours per day. Must have the ability to drive a company vehicle.


Qualifications

Education/Experience/Background:


Bachelor's degree in GIS, Geography, Computer Science, Engineering, Environmental Science, Data Science, or related field.
3 - 5 years applied GIS experience; experience with ESRI Product Suite (QGIS experience not considered).
Experience in a Utility environment preferred but not required.


Knowledge/Skills/Abilities


In-depth experience with Esri's suite of products including ArcGIS, ArcGIS Pro, Geodatabases, ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Web Apps, Survey123, Field Maps and Commercial grade GPS units (i.e. Trimble, Eos etc.)
Experience in editing GIS data in a versioned geodatabase (Enterprise SDE experience preferred, but no required.)
Experience in editing and querying GIS databases, building descriptive and cartographically sound maps, geocoding, and spatial analysis.
Experience with mobile data collection and GPS technology.
Knowledge of cartography, coordinate systems, map projections, and topology
Knowledge of GIS automation, scripting and languages such as ArcPy, Python and Arcade is a plus


Required Certification/Licenses/Training


Driver's License as some travel will be required.


Additional Information

Benefits: Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.

Title: Business Analyst, Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

Solarity Credit Union is seeking a fulltime Business Analyst in their Business Solutions department. The role involves driving structured change management and bridging business needs with technical solutions, while collaborating with various stakeholders to enhance organizational value.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Drive structured change management for technology and processes, from planning to support.

‚Ä¢ Bridge business needs and technical solutions using advanced analytical skills.

‚Ä¢ Identify strategic changes to optimize organizational value.

‚Ä¢ Meet weekly with the Business Solutions Manager to share highlights of status on current work and any roadblocks or issues that require attention.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with your department peers and provide recommendations for governance and process improvements that provide greater efficiency for executing on work for the organization, PMO and Business Lines.

‚Ä¢ Build relationships and meet with key stakeholders and sponsors to review and prioritize current work to ensure alignment against strategic initiatives and operational demands.

‚Ä¢ Hold conversations and effectively manage contract vendors / service providers on delivery of products and services against established scope, cost and milestones, escalating to the Business Solutions Manager as required on any issues or risks.

‚Ä¢ Continually assess Solarity / Business Line Technology platforms, processes and capabilities against the business needs, and provide recommendations for enhancements in architecture and software functionality.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate and partner with the applications team to review, prioritize and track IT Performance Team Sprints.

‚Ä¢ Write user stories, manage a few vendor calls, and write a few knowledge base articles for your departments.




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ 2 + years' experience in complex system design, programming or related experience.

‚Ä¢ Hands on software and hardware support with project leadership experience in technology innovation, design, implementation and process improvement.

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, or related field.

‚Ä¢ Technology consulting/client-facing experience.

‚Ä¢ A strong understanding of technology.

‚Ä¢ Experience in a financial institution.




Company:

Solarity Credit Union is a financial services firm based in Washington. Solarity Credit Union has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:

The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are looking for an Analyst to support our Growth, International Expansion, Lifecycle, and SEO stakeholders with a focus on improving our reporting and dashboard structure. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with business stakeholders and building data-driven narratives that enable clear decision making.




*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.




Your Responsibilities:

Work closely with analytics peers and marketing teams to narrate trends and insights, with a particular focus on our customer acquisition marketing programs.
Design reports and dashboards that enable clear, data-driven decision-making for marketing and cross-functional teams.
Refine our marketing attribution models to drive optimal resource allocation across paid and organic marketing channels.
Expand your expertise by supporting experiments such as A/B testing and Market Match tests to optimize strategies across multiple marketing functions.




Your Qualifications:

At least 2 years experience working with complex datasets to support business decision making.
Fluency in SQL.
Data visualisation tool experience (e.g. Mode, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to adapt your communication style to translate complex data insights for different audiences.
You have experience in owning small-to-medium projects from design to completion with limited guidance from your manager.
You understand when you are blocked, proactively seeking out for help within the team or the organization to move the project forward.




Nice to Have:

Python or R familiarity is helpful, but we welcome candidates eager to develop these skills.
Experience evaluating results of A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis.
Understanding of marketing metrics such as clicks, CPC, CTR, impressions, and unit economics like customer LTV, payback period, and CAC.




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO allowance
Private health insurance
Discounted gym membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
The HP Personalization & Industrial Business (PIB) offers an integrated portfolio of Services that enables predictable printing operations and optimized cost structure. It allows our customers to maximize press uptime, increase productivity, and grow their business.

The EMEA Competency Center is part of this organization, and our focus is to give support to our customers and help them to grow.

Our team actually giving support to the local service teams that are delivering onsite support to the HP Indigo customers. As part of our responsibilities we need to ensure that the knowledge is transferred from GBU to the local service teams. From our team we develop and deliver programs to help customer growth and improve current processes in the organization.

Responsibilities


Usage of different platforms to manage Data.
Creation of automatic reports to extract data that supports the organization in their operations and decisions

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and support data sourcing, curation, analysis, and quality assurance to deliver actionable insights for our clients. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and is eager to tackle complex data challenges with curiosity and precision.

The Data Analyst will be responsible for gathering business requirements, acquiring and manipulating large datasets, and ensuring data integrity throughout. This position requires strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.

Requirements

Personal Qualities

We‚Äôre Seeking Someone Who Is


Organized and deadline-driven
A self-starter who works well independently
Collaborative and a strong team player
Naturally curious with a ‚Äúdetective mindset‚Äù
Technically agile and eager to learn new tools
Committed to high-quality service delivery
Comfortable in a multidisciplinary, fast-paced environment


Responsibilities

Research scientific, clinical trial, and healthcare literature/databases


Conduct web searches (e.g., blogs, forums, news feeds)
Clean, validate, and curate data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Identify and implement improvements to data curation processes
Deliver high-quality results according to project timelines
Perform data mining and transformation tasks
Communicate progress, issues, and results to key stakeholders
Maintain and update internal documentation and SOPs
Support training sessions and assist with user onboarding


Skills Needed


Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel)
AI-oriented mindset with the ability to leverage relevant tools/technologies
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
High attention to detail and methodical approach to data quality
Excellent verbal and written communication in English
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage competing priorities
Experience working across cultures, time zones, and functions
Understanding of conference schedules, abstract submissions, and planning timelines
Knowledge of biotech and/or pharmaceutical clinical development processes


Qualifications Needed


Master‚Äôs degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biomedical Sciences, Molecular Biology, or related Life Sciences field
Experience working with large datasets
Familiarity with databases and/or query languages (e.g., SQL)
Proficient in English (spoken and written)

HTML:
Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and support data sourcing, curation, analysis, and quality assurance to deliver actionable insights for our clients. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and is eager to tackle complex data challenges with curiosity and precision.

The Data Analyst will be responsible for gathering business requirements, acquiring and manipulating large datasets, and ensuring data integrity throughout. This position requires strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.

Requirements

Personal Qualities

We‚Äôre Seeking Someone Who Is

  • Organized and deadline-driven
  • A self-starter who works well independently
  • Collaborative and a strong team player
  • Naturally curious with a ‚Äúdetective mindset‚Äù
  • Technically agile and eager to learn new tools
  • Committed to high-quality service delivery
  • Comfortable in a multidisciplinary, fast-paced environment

Responsibilities

Research scientific, clinical trial, and healthcare literature/databases

  • Conduct web searches (e.g., blogs, forums, news feeds)
  • Clean, validate, and curate data to ensure accuracy and consistency
  • Identify and implement improvements to data curation processes
  • Deliver high-quality results according to project timelines
  • Perform data mining and transformation tasks
  • Communicate progress, issues, and results to key stakeholders
  • Maintain and update internal documentation and SOPs
  • Support training sessions and assist with user onboarding

Skills Needed

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel)
  • AI-oriented mindset with the ability to leverage relevant tools/technologies
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
  • High attention to detail and methodical approach to data quality
  • Excellent verbal and written communication in English
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to manage competing priorities
  • Experience working across cultures, time zones, and functions
  • Understanding of conference schedules, abstract submissions, and planning timelines
  • Knowledge of biotech and/or pharmaceutical clinical development processes

Qualifications Needed

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biomedical Sciences, Molecular Biology, or related Life Sciences field
  • Experience working with large datasets
  • Familiarity with databases and/or query languages (e.g., SQL)
  • Proficient in English (spoken and written)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the company

We are Stayforlong, and for us travel is not just a means to an end but a journey of extraordinary moments and remarkable discoveries.




As firm believers in the enriching power of prolonged stays, we are passionate about nurturing meaningful connections with the places our customers visit. We reward their commitment to the journey with progressively cheaper rates, encouraging them to immerse themselves in the very essence of each destination.




We were born in Barcelona out of the need to disrupt an industry dominated by big corporations dictating how we should travel.




Since 2015, our commitment has been to empower our customers to break free from the constraints of an oversaturated market. We strive to offer a fresh perspective, giving them, hoteliers and our partners, the flexibility, opportunities and choices they deserve.

About the team

At Stayforlong we are currently a team of 80 people working in a dynamic and collaborative environment where people have the opportunity to grow and develop professionally.

We strongly believe in equal opportunities for everyone, both in the workplace and beyond. We like to create spaces where everyone's ideas are equally valued and heard.




We are committed to inclusion, diversity and work-life balance. We value a respectful work environment where all people are valued and respected regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, etc, etc, etc.




We started in a difficult business environment and have grown from there, which is why we admire nonconformists who fight against the odds, refuse to be intimidated, and help others along the way. With our digital DNA, we thrive on challenges, love to think outside the box, and move with the times.




Would you like to join us? üëã

Job purpose:

Currently, we're developing our Data department and need a Data Analyst to help grow our data organization.




The Data team at Stayforlong transforms raw information into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions. Our collaborative team of data engineers, analysts, scientists, and BI specialists works to enhance our competitive edge in the travel market through data-driven solutions.




We thrive in a dynamic environment fueled by analytical curiosity and continuous learning. Join us as we build a data-driven culture that powers business growth through innovative approaches to understanding our customers, products, and market.

Main job responsibilities are:

Transform business needs into actionable insights and clear visualizations
Build and maintain scalable, efficient dashboards with self-service capabilities
Conduct targeted analyses to support key business initiatives
Collaborate across teams to understand requirements and deliver data solutions
Ensure high data quality standards in all reporting
Develop and optimize efficient sql queries
Leverage IA to reduce as much as recurring tasks as possible

What you need to have:

At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role working.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Statistics or a related field
SQL proficiency, you know your way around optimization and scalability of queries.
Confident with BI visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Qlink, etc.
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines
Great communication and collaboration skills




Desirable:

Familiar with data transformation tools such as dbt / sqlmesh
Programming skills and specifically in Python.
Familiar with Snowflake

What we offer:

Permanent contract.
Immediate incorporation.
Full-time. Flexible schedule.
Possibility to work from home.
Office located in the center of the city (Barcelona).
Flexible remuneration: You will be able to include a restaurant card, transport card, kindergarten check, health insurance, and training.
Taking part in a multicultural company.
Excellent work environment.

Sign up for our job offer and discover what we can achieve together. We wanna meet you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst who enjoys Data Modeling in DBT, to work with a Pharmaceutical Organisation in Spain!




You will design, implement, and optimise data models using DBT, in a Snowflake cloud environment, that enable actionable insights across the business, particularly supporting analytics in clinical research, supply chain, and commercial operations.




Responsibilities:




Design and develop data models using DBT in a Snowflake cloud environment
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders to translate business needs into structured datasets and analytical frameworks
Maintain, document, and version control DBT models (sources, staging, marts, macros)
Perform data profiling, validation, and testing to ensure model quality and reliability
Optimise performance of DBT models and Snowflake queries for large-scale data operations
Ensure compliance with data governance, security, and regulatory requirements (e.g., GxP, GDPR)
Support visualisation and internal teams with (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) by providing clean, trusted datasets)




You will have hands-on experience with:

DBT for developing and managing modular, tested, and well-documented data models
Snowflake with an understanding of Snowflake-specific features
SQL, including the ability to write efficient, readable, and optimised queries for analytical workloads
Performance tuning in data environments
Git and version control best practices, ideally in a collaborative or production DBT workflow




In return, you will receive:

Competitive salary
Hybrid working model
The chance to work in a purpose-driven environment, where data plays a key role in shaping decisions that impact real lives and patient outcomes.




If you are ready to advance your career, and have the skills and ambition for this position, please email your CV to Emma Nayani-James.

Title: Data Analyst

üëã Who are we?

Founded in 2012, Take a Chef was born from the belief that exceptional culinary experiences should be accessible beyond traditional restaurant settings.

We envisioned a world where top-tier chefs could bring their talents directly to the dining tables of discerning individuals and families. üçΩÔ∏è

Combining cutting-edge technology üíª with a deep passion for food and hospitality ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•, we‚Äôve become the leading global platform for high-quality private chef services.

Last year, we served over 500,000 clients in more than 100+ countries, working with a network of 60,000+ private chefs and partnering with renowned luxury travel brands like Airbnb, Onefinestay, Le Collectionist and more. ‚ú®







üéØ About the role

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who‚Äôs passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights. If you love understanding business challenges, building dashboards, and automating data processes to empower decision-making across teams‚Äîthis might be your next role.







üõ†Ô∏è Responsibilities

üîç Deeply understand our business, products, and processes through data
üìä Create and maintain dashboards to track key metrics and visualize insights
üìà Generate reports and visualizations to communicate findings with clarity and impact
ü§ù Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, Design, and Marketing to support their data needs
üß∞ Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction using Python, SQL, and APIs







‚úÖ Requirements

üéì Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics)
üíº At least 2 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
üß† Strong experience (2+ years) with SQL, BigQuery, and Dataflow
üìà Hands-on experience (2+ years) with HubSpot and Amplitude
üöÄ Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, autonomous environment
üåç Fluency in English and Spanish
üìä Nice to have: Experience with BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI







Why choose us?

üíº Positive Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that values personal well-being and team spirit.
‚öñÔ∏è Work-Life Balance: We prioritize flexibility and support so you can flourish both professionally and personally.
üìö Employee Development: Paid training and workshops to help you grow and achieve your career goals.
üí∞ Competitive Compensation: We offer attractive salaries and annual bonuses to reward your impact.
üå¥ Paid Time Off: Enjoy 25 vacation days per year to relax, recharge, and explore your passions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.




Your responsibilities:

Generate actionable insights from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop user-centric analytics features (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to optimize tolling accuracy and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to support new use cases, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing model retraining and customization across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support regulatory compliance by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Strong SQL skills and experience with relational and columnar databases.
Solid understanding of dimensional data models (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in QLIK Sense, Power BI or similar dashboard tools.
Experience working with large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù) in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills




Nice to have:

Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum




Our offer:

Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth
Show more

Title: Data Analyst(They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
TBO.COM, an internationally recognized award-winning travel organization, is seeking an experienced Business Data Analyst to join our local team in Spain.

The Business Data Analyst will work alongside our BI Manager and the Revenue team, Data Architects, and business stakeholders to build regional insights and dashboards to assist in driving day-to-day business operations. This position reports directly to the Regional BI Manager and requires fluent English for universal communications.




Job Description:

Daily monitoring of regional performance and KPIs to ensure budget accomplishment.
Creating alerts and dashboards for the business units, controlling the entire business cycle.
Regularly working to optimize pricing setup and sub-unit performance.
Daily monitoring of ongoing promotions and assessment of business implementation influences.
Driving new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving regional efficiency.
Capturing and documenting business requirements using structured methodologies to accumulate offline data.
Utilizing and analyzing data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and presenting statistically sound analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders.
Translating the BI insights into business actions and regular communications.

Requirements:

At least 3 years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics, insights, BI, and a preference for experience in an Online Travel organization.
Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL.
Proficient in Power BI (preferred) or similar data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).
Bachelor's degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g., computer science, economics, finance, engineering).
Data-driven mindset in both decision-making and performance measurement.
Ability to understand and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Comfort in dynamic, fast-paced environments with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and coordinate resources independently.
Must have fluent English




TBO.COM supplies a wide portfolio of online travel products and provides our partners with a winning combination of price and exceptional service.

Interested in hearing more? Please apply with an English CV only.

Join our TBO.COM family!

Title: Analista de Datos de Consumos Energ√©ticos
Description:
Bienvenid@ a Eurostars Hotel Company, La Industria de la Felicidad







Eurostars Hotel Company es la cadena hotelera de Grupo Hotusa del que forman parte las marcas Eurostars Hotels, √Åurea Hotels, Exe Hotels, Ikonik Hotels, Crisol Hotels y Tandem Suites.




Actualmente, nuestro portofolio cuenta con m√°s de 250 hoteles con presencia en m√°s de 18 pa√≠ses de todo el mundo. Nuestra actividad est√° avalada por un importante know how que se refleja en todos los √°mbitos, desde la gesti√≥n hotelera a los valores de marca o al cuidado en la experiencia del hu√©sped.




Estamos convencidos de que el √©xito de una empresa reside en el desarrollo del talento y la ilusi√≥n del equipo humano que lo forma. Por ello, buscamos personas que sientan pasi√≥n por su trabajo y que quieran crecer con nosotros.







¬øQuieres unirte a la Industria de la felicidad?







Buscamos un/a Analista de Consumos Energ√©ticos.







Objetivo del Puesto







Analizar, interpretar y reportar datos de consumo energ√©tico en los hoteles de la compa√±√≠a, con el objetivo de detectar patrones de uso, identificar oportunidades de eficiencia energ√©tica y proponer mejoras sostenibles que contribuyan a la reducci√≥n del consumo y los costos asociados.










Responsabilidades Principales







Recopilar, organizar y validar datos de consumo energ√©tico (electricidad, gas, agua, etc.) de los diferentes hoteles de la compa√±√≠a.




Desarrollar dashboards e informes peri√≥dicos (semanales, mensuales, anuales) sobre el comportamiento energ√©tico de cada instalaci√≥n.




Identificar patrones de consumo, ineficiencias o desviaciones mediante an√°lisis estad√≠sticos y modelado de datos.




Generar proyecciones y simulaciones de consumo seg√∫n distintos escenarios operativos.




Proponer acciones correctivas y mejoras t√©cnicas o de comportamiento orientadas al ahorro energ√©tico.




Colaborar con los equipos de mantenimiento y operaciones para implementar y hacer seguimiento de las acciones recomendadas.




Apoyar en la implementaci√≥n y seguimiento de sistemas de gesti√≥n energ√©tica (por ejemplo, ISO 50001).




Mantenerse actualizado sobre nuevas tecnolog√≠as, normativas y mejores pr√°cticas en eficiencia energ√©tica aplicadas al sector hotelero.










Requisitos







T√≠tulo universitario en Ingenier√≠a Industrial, Energ√©tica, Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas o carreras afines.




T√©cnico Superior en Mantenimiento de Instalaciones T√©rmicas y de Fluidos.




T√©cnico Superior en Eficiencia Energ√©tica y Energ√≠a Solar T√©rmica.




M√≠nimo 2 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos energ√©ticos o en funciones similares.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hey, future Data Analyst! üëã

We are looking for an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our data team, composed of 4 people divided between Paris and Barcelona.




In this role, you will support our data-driven decision-making processes by assisting in the analyses and visualization of our main KPIs, as well as supporting the business teams in leveraging the company data. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience, develop your skills, and contribute to optimizing our online travel products and marketing strategies.




Ready to dive into data? Let‚Äôs go! üìä







Your Role at Weekendesk üöÄ

As a Junior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll play a key role in supporting our data-driven culture. You‚Äôll work side by side with senior analysts and business teams to turn data into actionable insights that fuel our growth.




Here‚Äôs what your day-to-day will look like:

Help create and maintain reports and dashboards to compute and follow key e-commerce metrics.
Collaborate with senior analysts and business teams to understand data requirements and deliver accurate, timely reports.
Identify data discrepancies and contribute to data quality initiatives.
Assist in performing ad-hoc data analysis to answer specific business questions.
Learn and apply best practices in data analysis and reporting.
Contribute to documentation of data processes and definitions.







Why Weekendesk is Your Perfect Match üí•

At Weekendesk, we believe in Teamwork & Family Spirit; Transparency & Communication and Respect & Trust as our core valuesüîù. That's what makes us special.

Ownership & Impact: Your analyses will directly influence product, marketing, and business decisions.
Professional Growth: Learn from experienced data professionals and take your analytical skills to the next level.
Work-Life Balance: With a hybrid work model (3 days in the office, 2 remote), 10 special home office days where you can work from anywhere in Europe, you‚Äôll enjoy the freedom to work in a way that suits your lifestyle.
A Vibrant Team Culture: Join a multicultural, collaborative team where new business ideas are valued and after-work eventsüçª bring everyone together.







Does This Sound Like You? üôã

1-3 years of experience in a data analysis, business intelligence, or similar role.
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline.
Proficiency in SQL is essential, with the ability to write and understand complex queries for data extraction and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Basic understanding of data analysis concepts and methodologies.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
You are fluent in English. French or Spanish is a plus.

Even better if you also have:

Experience with data viz (Tableau is a plus).
Familiarity with web analytics platforms, particularly Google Analytics (GA) is a plus.







Perks & Benefits ‚ú®

üìùPermanent contract (6-month trial period)

üçúMeal vouchers (5‚Ç¨/day net, Ticket Restaurant)

üéìUnlimited access to learning platforms (Goodhabitz)

üè†Hybrid work model: 3 days at the office, 2 remote + 10 home office days per year (work from anywhere in Europe within a 1-hour time difference)

üò∑Private health insurance discount

üéÅEmployee discount: 20% off Weekendesk bookings (because you deserve a break, too!)

üí∏Referral bonus: Bring in talented friends and earn!

üçµOffice perks: Free coffee, snacks, fruit.

üëØRegular social events: Whether it‚Äôs afterworks, themed parties, or big company events like our Summer Seminar, there‚Äôs always something to look forward to.




The Journey to Join Us üèÅ

First interview with senior data analyst with a technical test based on SQL & analyses skills
Second interview with Head of Data
Final Decision: We‚Äôll evaluate all candidates and send a personalized offer to the one who stands out.
Onboardingüéâ: Once you accept, we‚Äôll ensure you‚Äôre set up for success from day one, with a full onboarding experience and all the tools you need to thrive.




Ready to Take the Leap?üèÑ

Apply today and don't forget to visit our website to know more about us!üéâ

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Description:
Job Description

En MRM buscamos un/a Data Analyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo de Data Science & Business Intelligence, participando en proyectos innovadores para grandes marcas y sectores internacionales.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst plays a crucial role in consolidating, analyzing, and optimizing operational and financial reporting across multiple countries. This role ensures accurate data insights for process improvements and acts as a bridge between IT and operational teams. Additionally, the Senior Analyst serves as a Project Management Office (PMO) coordinator, ensuring smooth project execution and process documentation. The position also involves developing and delivering interactive training sessions to enhance data literacy and process understanding within the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, consolidate, and analyze reports from multiple regions to identify trends and performance gaps.
Develop data visualization dashboards and user-friendly reporting tools to improve decision-making.
Identify key data trends and detect anomalies (red flags), providing corrective action recommendations.
Collaborate with IT to ensure process flows are aligned with system capabilities and automation strategies.
Act as a PMO coordinator, tracking project timelines, milestones, and resource allocations.
Document operational processes, ensuring clear and structured process flows.
Support change management initiatives, driving seamless adoption of new systems and reporting structures.
Design and deliver interactive training sessions to enhance data analytics capabilities across teams.
Conduct workshops and hands-on sessions to ensure proper use of reporting tools and dashboards.
Travel regionally to support teams in implementing new data-driven initiatives and provide on-site training when needed.




Qualifications & Experience:

Degree in Business Analytics, Finance, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in multinational environments, handling regional data reporting and analytics.
Strong expertise in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and Power BI.
Background in project management, process documentation, and training facilitation.
Familiarity with finance, business analysis, or operational performance tracking.
Fluent English required; additional languages are a plus.




Key Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
High proficiency in data visualization and reporting.
Experience in process improvement and workflow optimization.
Strong project management and change management skills.
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively across different teams and cultures.
Capability to design and conduct training programs, using interactive methodologies to engage learners.
Strong presentation and facilitation skills, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Prime Insights

Prime Insights is a fast-growing US-based company connecting millions of users to market research surveys through proprietary panel apps. With a focus on slick UX, global reach, and high user incentives, we're building the next generation of rewarded apps ‚Äî and we‚Äôre just getting started.

At Prime Insights, we‚Äôre building one of the most powerful app ecosystems in the survey and reward space, and we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our performance team.

We believe great marketing decisions start with great data. As our Data Analyst, you‚Äôll transform complex data into clear, actionable insights‚Äîhelping us drive strategy and accelerate growth. You‚Äôll work closely with our Head of Growth & Data, who‚Äôs deeply involved in both analytics and marketing. Together, you‚Äôll elevate our data operations and make a direct impact on the business.

We‚Äôre especially looking for someone with hands-on experience in the app business, with a deep understanding of user behavior, mobile attribution, and Mobile Measurement Partners (MMPs) like AppsFlyer, Adjust, or Branch. If you thrive on turning data into performance improvements, we‚Äôd love to talk.







What You‚Äôll Do

Own and enhance Metabase dashboards: Build and refine dashboards and reports to support app and web marketing initiatives.
Advanced SQL analysis: Write, debug, and optimize complex SQL queries that power critical reporting.
Collaborate with marketing: Translate marketing questions into robust data insights‚Äîcovering ROAS, cohort LTV, attribution, channel efficiency, and more.
Lead attribution work: Analyze and improve attribution models across app and web, including SKAN, multi-touch, and probabilistic frameworks.
Work with MMP data: Integrate, validate, and analyze performance data from partners like AppsFlyer, Adjust, and Branch.
Support web analytics: Help drive performance reporting for web channels, leveraging tools like Google Analytics.
Identify and fix data gaps: Spot inconsistencies or missing data and propose scalable solutions across app and web analytics.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

2+ years of experience as a data or business analyst, ideally in mobile marketing or app-based businesses.
Expertise in SQL-you‚Äôre confident with complex queries and performance tuning.
Experience with Metabase or similar BI tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Strong marketing analytics knowledge: ROAS, LTV, cohorting, user acquisition, and attribution.
Practical experience with MMPs such as AppsFlyer, Adjust, or Branch.
Familiarity with SKAN and probabilistic attribution methods.
Solid understanding of web analytics and tools like Google Analytics.
A proactive, analytical mindset-you don‚Äôt just answer questions, you uncover opportunities.




How to Apply:

Use the Easy Apply button.




‚ùóImportant: We are not considering freelancers working on multiple projects simultaneously. This is a full-time position for a dedicated Data Analyst who‚Äôs ready to fully commit to a single product ecosystem and contribute meaningfully to its long-term success.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards



Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Unimedia Technology is looking for a Data Analyst with a strong foundation in data engineering to support our next-generation digital signage and advertising platform. This platform is already being used by major clients across Europe, and your contributions will directly enhance our ability to deliver accurate and timely insights.

You will play a key role in sourcing, preparing, and maintaining geographic and postal data, collaborating closely with product and development teams to ensure our data systems are accurate, efficient, and scalable.




Key Responsibilities
Research and acquire geographic, postal, and point-of-interest data from public and commercial sources.
Build and maintain scripts and pipelines to ingest, clean, and validate data.
Load structured datasets into a PostgreSQL database for downstream processing and analysis.
Collaborate with Product Owners and developers to ensure data quality and relevance across the platform.
Maintain clear documentation of workflows, scripts, and data structures to ensure transparency and reproducibility.







Required Qualifications
Proficiency in SQL, particularly with PostgreSQL.
Experience with Python or a similar language for data processing and automation.
Good understanding of data quality concepts, data cleaning, and data transformation techniques.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.







Preferred Qualifications
Experience with GIS tools such as QGIS or PostGIS.
Familiarity with version control systems, especially Git.
Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.
Basic understanding of PHP for occasional integration tasks.
Fluency in additional languages, especially those applicable to international postal systems.
Comfort with Linux/bash scripting and working in a command-line environment.




What We Offer
Competitive salary within the range of ‚Ç¨30,000 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨42,000, based on experience.
A flexible working environment.
Hybrid postion
English lessons 101
Private Health Insurance
The opportunity to contribute to a platform used by major European clients.
Professional development opportunities in both data analytics and data engineering.

Title: Data Academy | Junior Data Support Analyst
Description:
Talan ‚Äì Positive Innovation

Talan is an international consulting group specializing in innovation and business transformation through technology. With over 7,200 consultants in 21 countries and a turnover of ‚Ç¨850M, we are committed to delivering impactful, future-ready solutions.

Talan at a Glance

Headquartered in Paris and operating globally, Talan combines technology, innovation, and empowerment to deliver measurable results for our clients. Over the past 22 years, we‚Äôve built a strong presence in the IT and consulting landscape, and we‚Äôre on track to reach ‚Ç¨1 billion in revenue this year.

Our Core Areas of Expertise



Data & Technologies: We design and implement large-scale, end-to-end architecture and data solutions, including data integration, data science, visualization, Big Data, AI, and Generative AI.




Cloud & Application Services: We integrate leading platforms such as SAP, Salesforce, Oracle, Microsoft, AWS, and IBM Maximo, helping clients transition to the cloud and improve operational efficiency.




Management & Innovation Consulting: We lead business and digital transformation initiatives through project and change management best practices (PM, PMO, Agile, Scrum, Product Ownership), and support domains such as Supply Chain, Cybersecurity, and ESG/Low-Carbon strategies.






We work with major global clients across diverse sectors, including Transport & Logistics, Financial Services, Energy & Utilities, Retail, and Media & Telecommunications.

Job Description


At Talan, we have a unique opportunity to get trained, gain experience, and launch your career with one of the largest banks in Spain - a client that offers incredible growth and professional development opportunities.

What makes this program a great opportunity?

‚úÖ We invest in your future ‚Äì You‚Äôll receive top-notch training in both technical and soft skills, preparing you to thrive in the industry.

As part of our Data Academy, you will begin your journey into the world of data analytics, cloud platforms, and business intelligence. This program is designed to provide hands-on experience and structured training while you contribute to real-world data projects in a collaborative and agile environment.

You will work alongside experienced analysts and engineers, gradually building your technical, analytical, and communication skills in a supportive team setting.

Key Responsabilities:



Participate in structured training programs focused on data analytics, cloud fundamentals, and modern data tools.




Support data analysis and reporting tasks, contributing to the quality and consistency of business data.




Assist in monitoring data pipelines and scheduled workflows, learning how to identify basic issues or inconsistencies.




Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and support simple data validation or reconciliation activities.

Document processes, issues, and results clearly and contribute to knowledge-sharing with your team.




Engage in agile ceremonies and teamwork, developing both your technical and soft skills.




Gain exposure to real projects involving business intelligence tools, data governance platforms, and cloud-based workflows.




Learn the fundamentals of banking and treasury operations, gaining industry context for your work with financial data.






Qualifications

Have at least 6 month of experience or academic background in data analysis, technical support, or data platforms.




Have programming knowledge in Python, SQL, and Java.




Are eager to develop their skills in a fast-paced, hands-on learning environment.




Have basic experience with tools and platforms such as Power BI, Databricks, Hive, Impala, Hadoop, etc.




Are familiar with cloud environments (Azure) and automation (e.g., Control-M, Shell scripting).




Demonstrate strong attention to detail and an interest in reviewing and supervising data processes.




Thrive in agile, collaborative teams, and communicate clearly in both English (B2-C1) and Spanish (a strong plus).




Are adaptable, results-oriented, and eager to take on diverse technical responsibilities.






Education



Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, Certificate of Higher Education, or Vocational Education and Training in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar).






Qualities We Value



Energetic, motivated, and determined mindset




Pragmatic and results-driven




Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills




Adaptability and a proactive attitude toward learning




Strong time management and communication skills

Full-time contract
Smart Office Pack so that you can work comfortably from home.
Training and career development
