Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring
The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department
Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and within specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department
There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data
An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key
Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc
The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions
The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues
The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc
The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile and Skills to Success


Master‚Äôs Degree in Finance / Mathematics / Science / Engineering or related
At least 2 years of experience in a relevant data analysis field
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Python
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Client focused
Organisational skills
Proactivity


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Business Data Analyst and Power BI Developer
Description:
Job Description

The Position

We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Data Analyst & Power BI Developer to join our Analytics team.

As Senior Business & Data Analyst, you will be a key player in transforming complex business challenges into tangible, data-driven solutions. You will drive analytical process automation initiatives, uncover valuable business insights through data analysis, and adopt analytical solutions to address critical business needs. As a Senior Analyst, you will also mentor and guide other team members, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.


Responsibilities & Skills:
Business Acumen: Ability to understand complex business challenges, identify opportunities for improvement, and translate them into actionable data-driven solutions.
Drive process improvement initiatives by identifying bottlenecks, analyzing data to determine root causes, and designing innovative solutions that enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Design end-to-end BI reporting solutions, including dataflows, semantic models, dashboards, and reports
Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and align reporting solutions with business goals
Exceptional communication skills, enabling clear articulation of technical concepts to business stakeholders and effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Capable of translating business requirements into technical specifications for data analytical solutions, with experience in data integration, data cleansing, and data mining techniques.
Develop and implement analytical solutions to streamline reporting, analysis, and decision-making processes.
Develop insightful reports and dashboards, ensuring data accuracy, security, and effective data governance practices.
Proficient in SQL queries for data extraction, analysis, and manipulation, with a solid understanding of data warehousing principles.
Experienced in designing and implementing efficient data structures to support reporting and analysis needs, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Identifying opportunities to automate financial processes and reporting through AI technologies.


Requirements

Required Education, Experience, and Skills


A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Business Management, Economics or a related field is required; advanced degrees are a plus.
3-5 years of relevant experience in business and data analysis, experience in Power BI and data modeling
Background in data warehouse platforms such as Snowflake, combined with strong BI methodologies
Developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop.
Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence.
Experience with data visualization tools and techniques (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau).
Strong Excel Skills
Experience in developing and analyzing solutions using SQL scripts.
Understanding of enterprise-level data integration and strategies for performance optimization
Capability to bridge complex business questions into actionable data solutions
Proficiency in solving technical challenges within diverse, dynamic datasets
Python Knowledge
Nice to have Libraries: Pandas, NumPy, ScyPy, Seaborn, Matplotlib, Statsmodels, SciKit learn.

The Position

We are looking for an experienced Senior Business Data Analyst & Power BI Developer to join our Analytics team.

As Senior Business & Data Analyst, you will be a key player in transforming complex business challenges into tangible, data-driven solutions. You will drive analytical process automation initiatives, uncover valuable business insights through data analysis, and adopt analytical solutions to address critical business needs. As a Senior Analyst, you will also mentor and guide other team members, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.

  • Responsibilities & Skills:
  • Business Acumen: Ability to understand complex business challenges, identify opportunities for improvement, and translate them into actionable data-driven solutions.
  • Drive process improvement initiatives by identifying bottlenecks, analyzing data to determine root causes, and designing innovative solutions that enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Design end-to-end BI reporting solutions, including dataflows, semantic models, dashboards, and reports
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and align reporting solutions with business goals
  • Exceptional communication skills, enabling clear articulation of technical concepts to business stakeholders and effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.

  • Background in data warehouse platforms such as Snowflake, combined with strong BI methodologies
  • Developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop.
  • Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence.

  • Strong Excel Skills
  • Experience in developing and analyzing solutions using SQL scripts.

  • Capability to bridge complex business questions into actionable data solutions
  • Proficiency in solving technical challenges within diverse, dynamic datasets

Title: AI Analyst
Description:
Job Description

The Position

AI Analyst

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated AI Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying AI & Automation opportunities within our organization and designing a fit-for-purpose solution. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, analyze processes, and recommend AI-driven improvements.

Organon is a Women‚Äôs Health Company that believes in a better and healthier every day for every woman! We are a passionate, global community of thousands dedicated to redefining the future of women‚Äôs health. Our mission is to deliver impactful medicines and solutions for a healthier every day. But what really makes it work at Organon is our people.

We‚Äôre looking for real, passionate team players, curious innovators, forward thinkers, empowered by the idea of shaping their career, and ready to bring their fire to embrace change and the opportunities it brings for progress.

At Organon, you‚Äôll get to enjoy the best of both worlds: the open, agile, collaborative culture of a start-up, and operating at the scale of a fortune 500 company with an international footprint that serves people in more than 140 markets.

It‚Äôs going to be an exciting future‚Äîcome be a part of it!

Responsibilities


Identify AI & Automation Opportunities:
Collaborate with various departments to identify areas where AI can add value
Conduct research and analysis to stay updated on the latest AI trends and technologies
Document/map and evaluate current business processes to pinpoint inefficiencies and opportunities for AI & Automation
Technical Requirement Formulation:
Gather and document detailed business requirements for AI & Automation projects
Develop detailed documentation, including use cases, process diagrams, and technical requirements
Guarantee that all documented requirements are unambiguous, succinct, and in alignment with strategic business objectives
Stakeholder Engagement:
Act as a liaison between business units, technical teams, and external partners
Facilitate meetings and workshops to elicit requirements and validate solutions
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to manage expectations and project scope
Data Analysis:
Partner with Data & Analytics to identify AI-ready data sources
Develop dashboards to measure opportunities and support prioritization decisions
Training and Support:
Provide training and support to end-users on new AI systems and tools
Develop user guides and training materials
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI & Automation solutions


Qualifications

Required Education, Experience, and Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline and/or Technical certification with at least 2+ years analyst experience
Professional Experience: A track record of success as a Business and Technical Analyst, with a preference for those who have concentrated on AI & Automation technology projects
Analytical skills: Exceptional analytical abilities, capable of interpreting intricate data and formulating decisions based on data insights
Communication Excellence: Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, ensuring effective interaction and collaboration
Technical Proficiency: Skilled in data analysis and visualization tools, such as Power BI, and whiteboarding tools such as Mural/Miro to conduct discovery and design session with business
AI Familiarity: General understanding of AI technologies and their practical applications within business contexts
Project Management Expertise: Robust project management capabilities, adept at juggling multiple projects and priorities efficiently

Title: Business Services Data Analyst - HR
Description:
About Efficio

Efficio is a leading international procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices and clients across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We‚Äôre a diverse and growing team ‚Äì currently c.1400 people ‚Äì representing more than 50 different nationalities and speaking over 30 languages!

We're seeking a sharp, proactive HR and Talent Analyst to drive people-centric insights across HR. this role will own data analysis that powers talent reviews, workforce planning, compensation decisions, and more. This is an ideal role for someone excited to shape how we use people data to make better decisions.

Responsibilities:


Conduct analysis on employee reviews, budgets, expenses, and headcount plans
Build, refine, and automate HR dashboards and reporting tools (e.g., KPIs, diversity stats)
Partner closely with HR to synthesize data into business insights
Identify process inefficiencies and propose data-driven improvements
Support ad hoc analysis for leadership decision-making
Ensure confidentiality and discretion when handling sensitive employee data


Requirements:


1-2 years‚Äô experience in data analysis, ideally with exposure to HR or people analytics
Strong Excel / Google Sheets and familiarity with SQL or BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker)
Excellent communication skills in English ‚Äî written and verbal
Able to work autonomously and manage ambiguity
Proven experience working with confidential or sensitive data

Title: Data Analyst - RISK BCEF
Description:
About The Job


Within the RISK Portugal Hub of CPBS (Commercial, Personal Banking & Services), you will join the RISK BCEF Reporting team. As a RISK Reporting Data Analyst, you will be responsible for producing BCEF‚Äôs RWA (Risk-Weighted Assets) for both monthly and quarterly closings, in cooperation with the RISK BCEF Reporting teams in Paris, BCEF Finance, and Credit Risk Regulatory (CRR) teams in Lisbon. You will also contribute to the production of credit risk reporting and indicators to address increasing regulatory demands and the development of Retail and Corporate securitizations within BCEF
You will be working on various current credit risk and regulatory issues at the heart of banking within the largest entity of CPBS. You will gain a strong understanding of RWA calculations as well as the construction and analysis of key indicators for managing bank‚Äôs credit risk. In general, you will develop expertise in credit risk management, banking regulation (CRR3, EBA Guidelines ‚Äì LOM, NPE-FBE, etc.), and the data challenges within BCEF and RISK BCEF


Your Main Activities Are


During monthly and quarterly financial closings
Production of controls (accounting base, risk parameters EAD/PD/LGD, EL/ELBE shortfall) to critically assess the elements used in capital calculation
Identification of potential anomalies during the capital run and making necessary corrections
Production of dashboards to explain RWA amounts and their variations
Analysis and explanation of results from both an internal and standard approach (following the implementation of Basel 4 in January 2025), including the preparation of presentation materials
Post-financial closings, you will lead work to optimize BCEF‚Äôs RWA
Analyze and track the impact of compensations (RISK/Finance discrepancies) to reduce them in collaboration with the Finance teams in Madrid
Analyze risk parameters (freshness of ratings and RTS36 impacts, limiting risk parameters for defaulted items or those subject to management rules)
Contribute to improving the quality of data used (e.g., analyzing collateral, tracking remediation actions on data quality controls (Defensive and RDI controls), participating in the Data Quality Committee (COMET))
Finally, you will also contribute to the production of risk reporting and indicators
Produce and analyze credit risk indicators for recharges or new securitization vehicles to meet internal and regulatory requirements (including the future SLA between RISK BCEF and ALMT)
Produce regular regulatory reports (e.g., Short Term Exercise, Loan Tape CRE) or ad-hoc reports (e.g., BCE requests) in cooperation with the Paris reporting teams

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics or related
At least 5 years of experience in Data Analytics or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in
Tableau
Power BI
SQL
Ability to deliver / results driven
Ability to manage a project
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Communication skills, both written and oral

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: DATA ENGINEER - PYSPARK / PYTHON (HYBRID)
Description:
Portuguese company hires for hybrid work

Location: Lisbon, Portugal Candidates for this position must already be located in Portugal

Working Model: Hybrid - 60% Remote and 40% Presential

Language Requirements: Fluent Portuguese and english B2+

Seniority: 5+ years of experience

Sector: Energy

Instructions: Please send your CVs in English and make sure to include all skills and experience that match the requirements of the opportunity. This will significantly increase your chances of success.

We are looking Data Engineer to join our team. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines using PySpark and Python.You‚Äôll work with large-scale datasets, helping the organization transform raw data into actionable insights that drive real impact.


Your Role


We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines using PySpark and Python. You will handle large-scale datasets to empower data-driven decision-making across the company.

Your Main Responsibilities Will Include


Developing and optimizing data pipelines with PySpark.
Writing clean and efficient Python code to process, transform, and clean data.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and deliver on data requirements.
Ensuring data accuracy, scalability, and reliability.
Your Profile / Must be clearly listed on your CV:


You are passionate about data engineering and enjoy creating simple, efficient, and scalable solutions.

We Are Looking For Someone Who Has


Strong expertise in PySpark and Python.
Proven experience working with large datasets.
Basic understanding of ETL and databases.
Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong teamwork and communication skills.

Title: Data Center Tools and Reporting Specialist
Description:
Location: Lisbon (with weekly trips to Sines) or Sines

About the job:

We are looking for a Data Center Tools and Reporting Specialist to join our growing Operations team.

In this role, you'll turn raw data into strategic insights, enabling smarter, faster decision-making across the business. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to enhance process efficiency, drive data quality, and deliver impactful visualizations and reports.

You'll also take ownership of selecting, implementing, and managing IT tools that support data analysis and reporting, ensuring our operations are underpinned by the right technology and actionable intelligence.

This is an exciting opportunity to combine your technical data skills with your business mindset to make a measurable difference.

Key Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and validate data from systems such as CMMS, BMS, EPMS, CRM, ERP, and IoT platforms
Use SQL, Python or R to analyze data, identify trends, and generate insights
Build and maintain reports and dashboards using Excel, Power BI or Tableau
Collaborate with internal teams to define KPIs and reporting requirements
Present insights in a clear, engaging way to non-technical stakeholders
Support analytics initiatives such as forecasting, segmentation, and performance modelling
Monitor and improve data quality, contributing to robust data governance
Enhance IT tools and process flows that support reporting and data-driven decisions


Key Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field
2‚Äì5 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or similar roles
Strong proficiency in SQL and at least one statistical programming language (Python or R)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex data into clear stories
Knowledge of machine learning concepts and data modelling is a plus
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment


Why You'll Love It Here:




Impact: Lead world class operations at Europe's largest and most sustainable data center.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams and contribute to business development.
Flexibility: Empowered to lead with autonomy and creativity in a fast-paced, client-centric environment.
Growth: Join a company committed to innovation, professional development, and service excellence.


About Us:

At Start Campus, we provide mission-critical data center services that power businesses globally. We're customer-centric, innovative, and always looking to push boundaries.

If you're passionate about building relationships, driving customer success, and thriving in a tech-driven world, we want to hear from you!

If you think you have what it takes for this position and are looking for a new professional challenge send your application.

If you think you have what it takes for this position and are looking for a new professional challenge send your application.

Why Ayvens?

With over 3.4 million vehicles managed across more than 42 countries, we provide full-service leasing, flexible subscription services, fleet management services and multi-mobility solutions to customers of all sizes, including large corporates, SMEs, professionals, and private individuals. By leveraging our unique position to lead the way to net zero and further shape the digital transformation of the industry, we are well-positioned to meet the evolving mobility needs of our clients and provide them with the solutions they need to thrive.

At Ayvens, we believe that our success is driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction. Our team is dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and technology-enabled services that help our customers focus on their everyday business. We‚Äôre committed to sustainable mobility and have made it a core part of our strategy. In everything we do, we‚Äôre guided by the principles of authenticity, curiosity, commitment and collaboration. We aim to foster an organisation that's diverse in people and ideas, where everyone can thrive and be themselves, no matter who they are.

Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to enable the transformation towards large scale adoption of sustainable mobility and provide our customers with the solutions they need to succeed. Follow our page for the latest updates, news, and insights.

With over 3.4 million vehicles managed across more than 42 countries, we provide full-service leasing, flexible subscription services, fleet management services and multi-mobility solutions to customers of all sizes, including large corporates, SMEs, professionals, and private individuals. By leveraging our unique position to lead the way to net zero and further shape the digital transformation of the industry, we are well-positioned to meet the evolving mobility needs of our clients and provide them with the solutions they need to thrive.

At Ayvens, we believe that our success is driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction. Our team is dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and technology-enabled services that help our customers focus on their everyday business. We‚Äôre committed to sustainable mobility and have made it a core part of our strategy. In everything we do, we‚Äôre guided by the principles of authenticity, curiosity, commitment and collaboration. We aim to foster an organisation that's diverse in people and ideas, where everyone can thrive and be themselves, no matter who they are.

Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to enable the transformation towards large scale adoption of sustainable mobility and provide our customers with the solutions they need to succeed. Follow our page for the latest updates, news, and insights.

  • ALD Automotive | LeasePlan are rebranding to Ayvens across all 42 countries by 2025.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Flix, we offer a tech-driven environment where innovation meets real-world impact, with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a culture of collaboration and ownership.‚ÄØ

We are trailblazers in data-driven marketing. We firmly believe that successful marketing is rooted in high-quality data, and our commitment to support marketing teams with reliable data solutions is what sets us apart. You will work in a talented team of data engineers, data scientists & a product owner, delivering data products and models that empower marketing teams to take optimal budget steering decisions.

About The Role


Use Python, SQL, and Airflow to design and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines that deliver timely, actionable insights to marketing stakeholders.
Apply analytical thinking to understand complex data requirements and translate them into efficient data pipelines.
Ensure data quality through validation, monitoring, and clear documentation.
Proactively debug and refactor data pipelines to enhance performance, accuracy, and maintainability, based on a solid understanding of the underlying business logic.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering best practices within the team.
Collaborate with the Product Owner and cross-functional teams to understand marketing stakeholders' data needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Assist with ad hoc requests and help resolve data-related issues by applying both technical and analytical problem-solving skills.
Participate in the continuous improvement of data infrastructure by optimizing pipeline performance, enhancing data models, and integrating scalable, future-proof solutions.


About You


You‚Äôve had hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and Git.
You hold a degree in Computer Science or a related field. Candidates from Business or Marketing backgrounds with strong technical experience are also welcome.
You think critically, ask insightful questions, and enjoy turning complex business requirements into clean, effective code.
You are experienced with relational databases and excel at writing complex SQL queries.
You thrive in team settings, communicate well, and are fluent in English.
Bonus: Experience with Airflow, AWS, terraform, CI/CD tools; having worked in Marketing Domain.


We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you!‚ÄØ

What We Offer


Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family.
Work from (M)Anywhere: Depending on your role, work from another location for up to 60 days per year.
Hybrid work model: We are an office-first company, but we offer flexibility to balance work and life.
Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members.
Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills.
Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career.


To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, we empower our teams to push boundaries and shape the future of mobility. As we continue to scale globally, we harness cutting-edge technology to make mobility smarter, more sustainable, and more affordable.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place where you can drive change and redefine how millions of people travel, Flix is the place where you can lead your journey!

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/*)
Description:
Our Engineering community is growing, and we‚Äôre now looking for a Data Engineer to join our team supporting our global growth.

As Data Engineer, you design and optimize data processing algorithms on a talented, cross-functional team. You are familiar with the Apache open-source suite of technologies and want to contribute to the advancement of data engineering.

What We Offer


A chance to accelerate your career and work with outstanding colleagues in a supportive learning community split across 3 continents
Contribute your ideas to our unique projects and make an impact by turning them into reality
Balance your work and personal life through our workflow organization and decide yourself if you work‚ÄØat home, in the office, or on a hybrid setup
Annual performance review, and regular feedback cycles, generating distinct value by connecting colleagues through networks rather than hierarchies
Individual development plan, professional development opportunities
Educational resources such as paid certifications, unlimited access to Udemy Business, etc.
Local, virtual, and global team events, in which UT colleagues become acquainted with one another


What You‚Äôll Do


Support the development and maintenance of data pipelines and ETL processes, with a focus on learning and applying Databricks technologies.
Assist in data ingestion, transformation, and validation tasks across structured and semi-structured sources.
Participate in team code reviews, documentation, and knowledge-sharing sessions to build Databricks proficiency.
Collaborate with senior engineers to implement scalable solutions and gradually take ownership of Databricks workflows.
Contribute to improving data quality, observability, and operational efficiency.


What You‚Äôll Bring


Solid foundation in SQL and Python, with a strong interest in distributed data processing and cloud platforms.
Eagerness to learn Databricks, Apache Spark, and modern data engineering practices.
Familiarity with version control (e.g., Git) and basic understanding of cloud services (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
Analytical mindset, attention to detail, and a collaborative attitude.
Motivation to grow into a Databricks expert through hands-on experience and mentorship.
Professional communications skills in English


Did we pique your interest, or do you have any questions?

We want to hear from you: contact us at recruit@ultratendency.com

About Us

Ultra Tendency is an international premier Data Engineering consultancy for Big Data, Cloud, Streaming, IIoT and Microservices. We design, build, and operate large-scale data-driven applications for major enterprises such as the European Central Bank, HUK-Coburg, Deutsche Telekom, and Europe‚Äôs largest car manufacturer. Founded in Germany in 2010, UT has developed a reliable client base and now runs 8 branches in 7 countries across 3 continents.

We do more than just leverage tech, we build it. At Ultra Tendency we contribute source code to +20 open-source projects including Ansible, Terraform, NiFi, and Kafka. Our impact on tech and business is there for anyone to see. Enterprises seek out Ultra Tendency because we solve the problems others cannot.

We love the challenge: together, we tackle diverse and unique projects you will find nowhere else. In our knowledge community, you will be a part of a supportive network, not a hierarchy. Constant learning and feedback are our drivers for stable development. With us you can develop your individual career through work-life balance.

We evaluate your application based on your skills and corresponding business requirements. Ultra Tendency welcomes applications from qualified candidates regardless of race, ethnicity, national or social origin, disability, sex, sexual orientation, or age.

Data privacy statement: Data Protection for Applicants ‚Äì Ultra Tendency

Title: Product Analyst - ComparaJ√°
Description:
About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across four markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our four markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
EU work permit is required


Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

Title: Functional Analyst
Description:
Muito Gosto! Somos o Grupo DATA!

O nosso prop√≥sito √© simplificar a vida dos nossos clientes e fazemos isso em todo o mundo, atrav√©s das nossas solu√ß√µes de TI.

Somos uma multinacional, que opera ativamente em Portugal, e estamos em constante expans√£o!

Adoramos trabalhar com grandes empresas e fazer crescer as empresas com as quais colaboramos.

Comprometemo-nos a ser a mudan√ßa que queremos ver nas grandes corpora√ß√µes do mercado, come√ßando por valorizar as pessoas e as suas ideias.

J√° percebemos que n√£o existe apenas uma maneira de fazer as coisas funcionarem, que cada um dos nossos colaboradores tem caracter√≠sticas √∫nicas e que, para trabalhar em equipa, precisamos realmente de nos conhecer.

Quem procuramos?

Functional Analyst

You are going to participate in the requirements gathering and analysis. Besides, your goal will be to understand business rules, work with SQL (perform queries, etc.) and do data modelling.

Your tasks will be:


Gathering and analyzing the needs of the interested parties;
Documenting the requirements clearly and precisely through functional specifications, flow diagrams, use cases, among others
Working in collaboration with the development team
Provide guidance and clarification on the functional requirements and act as a validator, so that you ensure that the functionalities implemented correspond to the defined requirements.

6+ years of experience with Functional Analysis
SQL experience (know-how in queries, procedures)
Technical and functional analysis, Feature Files and RUP
Data modelling
Experience with Use Cases, Diagrams, Flowcharts, Prototypes, SVN
Good soft skills

Title: OPC Reporting and Automation - Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Global Markets Operational and Permanent Control (GM OPC) set-up faces increasing Regulatory and Conduct demands beyond pure Operational Risk. As part of Strategy Conduct and Risk (SCR), GM OPC operates over the 3 main regions, through the three following Practices:


Regulatory Practice: support any regulatory requirement with a sustainable framework, in line with the dedicated Governance, Control Plan & Risk Assessment
Conduct Practice: assess and challenge the effectiveness of the Conduct control set-up as well as ensure a full convergence between Conduct Risk Identification (CRI), Risk and Control Self-Assessment ‚Äì RCSA).
Operational Risk Practice: contribute to protect the business (P&L, reputation)


The three Practices are further supported by three transversal Streams ‚Äì Protection (Management and monitoring of incidents, remediation actions and recommendations), Prevention (Deploying RCSA and contribute to Operational risk computation) and Supervision (Validation process and Coordinating the internal control Governance and other Regulatory-based committees).

Your Main Activities Are


Support the team to produce regular reporting on the main operational risk indicators, and proactively suggest improvements on the reports;
Use different tools to collect and analyze data, as well as structuring queries and performing routine maintenance of reports;
Perform trend analysis comparison to previous weeks/months/quarters
Proactively suggest improvements on reports on a continuous basis and promote digital solutions
Ensure data input & quality check;
Support the execution of governance committees and presentations
Support the OPC team with Ad-Hoc requests (Statistics; Kpis; presentations; etc.)
Liaise & Interact with OPC teams worldwide


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor, Post-Graduation or Master Degree in Data Science; Management, Finance, Science, Maths;
Excellent knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, VBA, Power BI, (other languages would be a plus)
Analytical and quantitative skills, Precision, rigorousness;
Excellent organizational skills
Team spirit, ability to work with others;
Ability to communicate clearly in both oral and written form (English);
Experience in investment banking is an advantage.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

Your Role

As a Data Modeler, you will bridge business needs and technical design, working closely with Product Owners, Data Architects, and Engineers. Your main focus will be on translating requirements into data models, enabling robust ETL/ELT development and analytics.

Key responsibilities:


Design facts, dimensions, and KPIs in a DPaaS environment.
Build logical and physical data models using PowerDesigner.
Identify data gaps, define data quality rules, and generate DDL.
Support ETL teams by providing model-driven structures and collaborating on source-to-target pipelines.
Work with tools such as Matillion, Informatica, or SSIS as needed for integration.


Your Profile

You are a hands-on data professional with strong modeling and architecture skills.


Experience with PowerDesigner or similar tools.
Knowledge of data architecture, dimensional modeling, and data quality.
Familiarity with ETL concepts and pipeline design.
Strong SQL and DDL generation skills.
Comfortable working with cross-functional teams in a hybrid technical/business role.


What You'll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Access valuable training and certifications in cutting-edge technologies.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Title: Senior Data Analyst Regulatory Data Management
Description:
About The Job

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.

Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Actively manage clients
Support and monitor the run of these actvities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Coach as necessary more junior members of the team
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor's Degree in IT, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Mathematics or any similar areas
Advanced level of english fluency, both oral and written
At least 3 years of experience in data analytics, operational risk or compliance activities
Experience using Microsoft Office Tools, particularly Excel
Proficiency in Power BI and SQL
Attention to detail and analytical thinking


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union's leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group's retail activities and specialized business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialized businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.


Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit [1] [1] https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Database Engineer
Description:
Building services that enable others

Springer Nature is one of the world‚Äôs leading global research, educational and professional publishers. It is home to an array of respected and trusted brands and imprints, with more than 170 years of combined history behind them, providing quality content through a range of innovative products and services. Every day, around the globe, our imprints, books, journals and resources reach millions of people, helping researchers and scientists to discover, students to learn and professionals to achieve their goals and ambitions. The company has around 10,000 staff in over 50 countries.

We‚Äôre looking for an experienced Database Engineer, with an IaC mindset, who will help us fulfil our mission to enable product teams to focus on delivering value.

About us: Engineering Enablement

The Engineering Enablement (EE) department consists of around 60 people, spread over teams that closely collaborate to fulfil our mission. In Springer Nature Technology (SNT) we serve different core expertise: PaaS, Databases, Observability and Cloud- and Release Engineering. You will join a multidisciplinary team with different nationalities, backgrounds and experience levels. We are a very distributed department but sometimes we travel to work with each other in person. We are based around the globe with main locations in London, Dordrecht, Berlin, Lisbon and New York.

Our Technology

We have built platforms serving hundreds of developers at scale around the world. We are making more and more use of Kubernetes as a backend container platform and integrating this into our platform offering. We are leveraging the power of Kubernetes to build a new PaaS that will co-exist with the current Cloud Foundry Platform, as well as managing an internal database platform that runs over 1,200 database servers.

Your team

This role is within the Database Engineering team, who are responsible for providing our managed database platform.

The team consists of Platform Engineers and Database Engineers who work together to provide managed database services - and the underlying cloud-based infrastructure - for internal customers across the organisation.

As with all teams in EE, we closely collaborate with the departmental teams that provide the platform‚Äôs surrounding and centralised services (CI/CD system, observability tools and our internal runtime platforms) and so with all the product development teams within Springer Nature.

Your responsibility

Together with the team, you will share the responsibility of maintenance tasks, documentation, running updates and keeping our systems secure.

Along with your team members, you provide expert services and guidance to development and product teams across Springer Nature and further develop our database infrastructure platform.

You will contribute to the evolution of our database services through leveraging IaC, maximising customer self-service and living the continuous integration mindset. You help to improve and optimise the existing database platform to maximise capacity for consultation with internal customers.

As one of the database experts for relational and document-store dbs, you help your customers to choose the best solution for their needs, providing advice and guidance on schema setup and query tuning.

Key Tasks:


Maintaining and improving the database systems in production and development environments.
Provisioning, configuring, patching, upgrading, and maintaining databases.
Automating the management of new and existing databases to ensure that processes are repeatable and scalable.
Ensuring high availability of databases through clustering, replication, and other techniques.
Taking an active role in supporting and in finding the root cause of operational issues and preventing recurrences.
Contributing to our managed database platform, and working processes, which we use as a foundation for providing our services to the rest of the company.
Working with the team to document processes, procedures, and technical designs related to database management.
Monitoring and optimising database performance, including configuration, resource usage and query tuning.
Taking an active role in collaborating across the engineering department on database related topics and integrations.
Working with colleagues, internal customers and stakeholders on new features and capabilities.


You will have the opportunity to work on new challenges and drive the evolution of our services in a collaborative and supportive environment.

About You

You are a friendly team member who is modest, humble and open to learning from anyone regardless of age, gender, race, role or experience. You value social interactions, are open to feedback and introspection and you can self-reflect by asking questions.

You are confident in your abilities but aware of your limitations. You have a strong preference for working together, collaborating across domains and practices, sharing knowledge and training others as opposed to quickly getting things done alone. You understand the value of doing meaningful and sustainable work rather than implementing temporary fixes to meet arbitrary deadlines.

Desired Skills and Experience:


Knowledge and experience of MongoDB and PostgreSQL
Experience with Infrastructure as Code, for automation and configuration management
Programming experience with Golang, Ruby, Python or at least one modern language
Experience in operating and maintaining cloud infrastructure
Experience with automation frameworks (e.g. Terraform, Puppet or Ansible)
Understanding of database architecture, backup and recovery, and performance tuning
Experience with database clustering and replication mechanisms.


Preferred Skills and Experience:


Experience of working with Cloud SQL
Experience using Google Cloud Platform
Experience of using (and ideally developing) REST APIs
Experience of developing web applications
Experience with common CI/CD tools
Docker and containerisation
Experience in contributing to the architecture and design of new and existing systems
Unix shell scripting or programming experience
High user and customer orientation
High sensitivity for security-relevant issues
Strong conceptual skills, logical/analytical thinking & problem-solving skills


We are looking forward to your application. After reviewing your CV our Talent Acquisition team will contact you to schedule a short initial phone/video call. After getting this first step we will run 2-3 rounds (introductory, technical, cultural) with you - all of these with different members of the Engineering Enablement team. When appropriate these phases will be held via phone /video calls.

You have a strong preference for working together, collaborating across domains and practices, sharing knowledge and training others as opposed to quickly getting things done alone. You understand the value of doing meaningful and sustainable work rather than implementing temporary fixes to meet arbitrary deadlines.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • Knowledge and experience of MongoDB and PostgreSQL
  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code, for automation and configuration management
  • Programming experience with Golang, Ruby, Python or at least one modern language
  • Experience in operating and maintaining cloud infrastructure
  • Experience with automation frameworks (e.g. Terraform, Puppet or Ansible)
  • Understanding of database architecture, backup and recovery, and performance tuning
  • Experience with database clustering and replication mechanisms.

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Experience of working with Cloud SQL
  • Experience using Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience of using (and ideally developing) REST APIs
  • Experience of developing web applications
  • Experience with common CI/CD tools
  • Docker and containerisation
  • Experience in contributing to the architecture and design of new and existing systems
  • Unix shell scripting or programming experience
  • High user and customer orientation
  • High sensitivity for security-relevant issues
  • Strong conceptual skills, logical/analytical thinking & problem-solving skills

We are looking forward to your application. After reviewing your CV our Talent Acquisition team will contact you to schedule a short initial phone/video call. After getting this first step we will run 2-3 rounds (introductory, technical, cultural) with you - all of these with different members of the Engineering Enablement team. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Quantitative Data Intelligence, Python, SQL, GIT, Optimization

Your Main Activities Are


Leverage large volumes of data from internal sources
Develop, maintain, and support data pipelines
Understand and be the point of contact for the business and assess its needs
Ensure architecture meets business requirements
Recommend ways to efficiently provide quality data and added value
Communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders, including data analysts, product managers, and business leaders
Prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results


Profile And Skills To Success


3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong background in data architecture
Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analysze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines


Desired Experience And Knowledge


Tableau/PowerBI or other visualization tools
CI / CD (Jenkins)
Knowledge and interest in financial markets are a plus


About The Team

The Quantitative Data Intelligence (QDI) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.

The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.

Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.

We seek to shape the technologies available to the client's needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Professionals With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field;
  • Minimum 4 years of experience as a Data Engineer;
  • Previous experience working with Python (developing data-related Python frameworks is a plus);
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as PySpark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow and Presto;
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL and/or PL/SQL;
  • Experience creating data sources on Data Visualization softwares like Tableau and PowerBI is a plus;
  • Organizational and communication skills;
  • Proactivity and dynamism;
  • Good English level (mandatory).

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ABOUT US

Indie Campers, the go-to campervan Marketplace, is on a mission of making road trips available to everyone. Thanks to its digital approach and customer-centric orientation, Indie Campers has developed a strong booking experience and high-quality road trips at affordable prices.

With over one million nights rented through our travel platform, we have welcomed more than 300,000 travelers from 169 countries. We offer a comprehensive and expanding array of road trip possibilities: short-term RV rentals, long-term campervan subscriptions, and the possibility of buying one of our vehicles available for sale.

Rooted in a deep technological focus, our challenges are both exciting and demanding and require top talent and motivation to be successfully pursued. We are growing our team and looking for those interested in pursuing this dream with us and joining an ever-developing journey.

THE ROLE

As Indie Campers Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building Indie Campers systems for data collection, management, and conversion, turning raw data into usable information for our Data team and various Business Stakeholders to use.

You'll be developing the data pipelines and systems that power Indie Campers' data-driven business and enable the future-looking features we're currently developing powered by big data and AI.

You will join our Global Data team in our Lisbon HQ, report directly to our Data Lead, and work closely with Engineering, Product, Marketing, Revenue, and Operations teams.

WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?

As a Data Engineer at IndieCampers, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our Data and AI capabilities. Working alongside a team of talented experts, you will:


Design, build, and maintain efficient and scalable data pipelines.
Develop innovative tools and frameworks to enhance the data platform.
Foster a data-driven culture across the company.
Collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts to deliver actionable insights, forecasts, and optimization strategies.
Establish and maintain data quality standards across the organization.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


5+ years of experience in Data Engineering.
Proficiency in relational and non-relational databases including PGSQL, MongoDB, BigQuery, Redshift ;
Familiarity with a technology stack that includes experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Chef, and Terraform.
Familiar with modern architecture and engineering best practices: microservices, CI/CD, infrastructure-as-code, monitoring, incident response
Experience with first-hand principles and trade-offs of software engineering, like algorithms, concurrency, asynchronous & reactive processing, distributed systems. Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals such as algorithms, asynchronous & multi-threaded processes
Prior experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, QuickSight, Metabase, Power BI);Experience working in with or implementing data pipelines, from ingestion to serving, with technologies such as Kafka, Postgres, S3 / GCS, Spark, and Databricks/Snowflake.
