Title: Quantitative Models Analyst
Description:
About The Job

This position will allow the applicant to become a central player within BNPP CCP domain, the latter an essential market infrastructure in the daily activity of the Bank. The post will provide an opportunity to interact across many functions within the group, allowing to:


Develop a network through collaboratively working with numerous stakeholders on a daily basis.
Development of technical expertise regarding margin model practices and quantum insights by closely following market evolutions and its drivers.
Direct interaction with CCPs and market forums.


Your Main Activities Are

Quantitative Assessment


Monitoring and controlling risk-facing margin algorithms put in place by market infrastructure entities, considering among others the use, hypotheses, suitability, calibration and its overall performance
Understanding the risk drivers of margin models, and their dependency on portfolios and market parameters
Parallel building and replication of CCPs models when available information so permits it, quantifying errors and their significance
Proactive and enthusiastic attitude with a drive to learn and build up an expansive knowledge of the market field


Quantitative Opinion Contribution


Timely providing a quantitative assessment on the robustness of margin models to help Credit Analysts produce a holistic opinion regarding CCPs and its suitability for the magnitude of BNPP exposures on a given market
Present clear and concise quantitative assessments for ad-hoc requests related to new CCP-related activities
Participate in international forums and contribute to produce BNPP risk assessments on the given topics
Ability to work independently and diligently


RISK Monitoring


Continuously monitor the portfolio of counterparties under own responsibility, jointly with Credit Analysts, highlighting any quantitative issues that may require a specific review
Driving the necessary changes to work towards a more robust risk management platform in the market
Ensuring that the counterparty data management is conducted well, namely on-boarding, collection of documents, and commensurate limits update


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs Degree in Quantitative Finance / Mathematics / Engineering / Statistics and/or Physics
Strong and proven analytical skills
Creativity & innovation / problem solving
Rigorous and reliable
Adaptability and proactivity, multitasking
Ability to organize and prioritize high volume workloads
Strong presentation and communication skills (verbal and written)
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Programming Skills, preferentially in Python but not mandatory
Knowledge of financial instruments and their risk drivers is a plus
Fluency in English


About The Team

As part of Financial Institutions Coverage (FIC) within Global Banking (GB), the Institutional Credit Analysts Team (ICAT) oversees credit analyses of all institutional clients, intragroup entities, sovereigns and market infrastructures. In this domain, the Market Infrastructure ‚Äì Central Clearing Counterparties (CCP) Team provides a holistic view of risks facing by these market infrastructures, integrating counterparty credit risk analysts as well as quantitative analysts within the team. It is a global team with presence in London, Paris, New York, and Hong Kong. The CCP Quantitative Analyst will work as part of the integrated "FIC ICAT - CCPs & ALGO" team and will be based in Lisbon.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join Us

At Vodafone, we‚Äôre not just shaping the future of connectivity for our customers ‚Äì we‚Äôre shaping the future for everyone who joins our team. When you work with us, you‚Äôre part of a global mission to connect people, solve complex challenges, and create a sustainable and more inclusive world. If you want to grow your career whilst finding the perfect balance between work and life, Vodafone offers the opportunities to help you belong and make a real impact.

What You‚Äôll Do

Coding, data, technology ‚Äì that‚Äôs your world! Be part of our Digital Operations Teams and shape new and innovative solutions for the transformation of Vodafone towards the Digital Telco. Work with state-of-the art tools and open-source libraries.

As a member of the Vodafone Network Operations Data Science team your main focus will be to employ data science methods to analyse large data sets and implement your findings in professional software for real-time network problem detection and automated resolution.

Main Accountabilities:


Develop software in a dynamic team employing agile development processes and Python
Employ statistical methods to correlate network parameters, network topology and customer experience data to identify network problems and solve them automatically and predictively
Evaluate large data sets with state of the art data science methods like machine learning, classification, clustering and pattern search
Design and implement algorithms to detect network and service problems in real-time
Implement your findings and take cross-functional responsibility from development towards go-live and operations (DevOps)
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the development process in the team with CI/CD and your innovative ideas



Who You Are


Academic Background in computer science, physics, mathematics or communications engineering
Strong problem solving and solution-oriented thinking
Very strong analytical capabilities, data science and statistics know-how and proven track record of implemented solutions
Strong programming skills and experience in software development, especially with Python
Knowledge of Agile methodologies and development tools
Fluent in English



Not a perfect fit?

Worried that you don‚Äôt meet all the desired criteria exactly? At Vodafone we are passionate about empowering people and creating a workplace where everyone can thrive, whatever their personal or professional background. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align exactly with every part of the job description, we encourage you to still apply as you may be the right candidate for this role or another opportunity.

What's In It For You


Hybrid Work Model - Flexible hybrid work model with 8-10 in-office days per month, managed by team leaders
Vodafone Products and Services - Employees get a mobile phone, free communication plan, data card, and various discounts on services and products
Recognition - Recognition programs for innovative, creative, high-potential employees and exemplary behaviors
Health and Well-being - Well-being Program offers nutrition and psychological consultations, webinars, workshops, and discounts on various services and products
Learning - Access to Communities of Practice and a customizable digital training platform with high-quality content (namely Harvard Business Publishing and Skillsoft)
Local and International Mobility - Internal recruitment with local and international rotation opportunities across departments and roles



Who We Are

We are a leading international Telco, serving millions of customers. At Vodafone, we believe that connectivity is a force for good. If we use it for the things that really matter, it can improve people's lives and the world around us. Through our technology we empower people, connecting everyone regardless of who they are or where they live and we protect the planet, whilst helping our customers do the same.

Belonging at Vodafone isn't a concept; it's lived, breathed, and cultivated through everything we do. You'll be part of a global and diverse community, with many different minds, abilities, backgrounds and cultures. ;We're committed to increase diversity, ensure equal representation, and make Vodafone a place everyone feels safe, valued and included.

If you require any reasonable adjustments or have an accessibility request as part of your recruitment journey, for example, extended time or breaks in between online assessments, please refer to https://careers.vodafone.com/application-adjustments/ for guidance.

Together we can.

You'll be part of a global and diverse community, with many different minds, abilities, backgrounds and cultures. ;We're committed to increase diversity, ensure equal representation, and make Vodafone a place everyone feels safe, valued and included.

If you require any reasonable adjustments or have an accessibility request as part of your recruitment journey, for example, extended time or breaks in between online assessments, please refer to https://careers.vodafone.com/application-adjustments/ for guidance.

Together we can.

Title: Data Engineer, Data Foundation Team (Hybrid)
Description:
Job Req Number: 70859

Time Type:

Data Engineer ‚Äì Data Foundation Team (Hybrid)

At DSV, we are on a journey to renew the Global Data and Analytics Platform that is being used by colleagues, customers and Business Partners in all Business Domains to get the most information out of available data.

Our department members are placed in numerous locations around Europe, Asia and South Africa.

A significant part of our department is located in Lisbon, grouped in development and operations teams.

For the Data Foundation Team, we are looking for a Data Engineer to support the team of currently 3 team members plus the Manager.

The position is part of the Global organisation and work will be in close collaboration with colleagues across locations in the department.

To achieve our goals, we are working on an ambitioned plan and have chosen a vendor who is offering us a full stack of services. All of our work is done in the cloud, utilising the full stack of Microsoft‚Äôs offering: Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Server /Azure SQL Synapse, Azure Analysis Services, DataBricks, PowerBI Services, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps.

DSV will also embark on a multi cloud strategy and introduce technologies to facilitate cloud provider agnosticism.

The Data Foundation team works as technology spearheads and supports the delivery and operations teams with tools, frameworks, processes, and coaching. We deliver in an agile way with Jira as our management tool.

As a Data Engineer in Data Foundation Team, your major responsibilities will be:



Manage and optimize cross department tools.
Be a key member in cross data foundation implementation projects.
Analyse existing applications and optimize their performance.
Design and implement solutions that will support the development of our Operational Data Warehouse (ODW) in alignment with IT Architectural principles, guidelines, and standards.
Rapidly build up understanding of existing architecture and underlying business processes
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines for ingesting, processing, and transforming large volumes of data from various sources.
Analyse requirements together with our different department teams.
Document and provide technical specifications for the implementations.
Refine and promote our agile delivery framework to help ensure high quality and flexible deliverables on the data & BI platform.
Actively transfer knowledge to other team members as well as the Operations & Support team.



Skills & Competencies

To perform the job successfully you should demonstrate the following competencies:



Analytical Skills: Ability for systematic and rational analysis to identify the root cause of problems.
Delivery & Project Management: Experience with Agile methodology, and the ability to promote and facilitate deliveries accordingly.
Conversational Skills: Being comfortable in international business communication, able to communicate openly and confidently, able to listen effectively, able to influence and convince others in a way that results in acceptance and agreement.
Personal Skills: Ability to work with different cultures and to manage cross functional interfaces, high priority for teamwork, capable to build strong and long-term team relationships within and across functions and geographical boundaries and based on ethics and trust, ready to take personal accountability for achieving individual and shared goals.



Required Experience:



Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer sciences, Data Science, Information Technology or a related field.
3-5 years of experiences in BI/Data Engineering projects.



Technical requirements:



Expert knowledge of Microsoft‚Äôs Data stack: Azure Datalake, Azure SQL Database/Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Synapse integration, DevOps, etc
Ability to monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability.
Experience with profiling and tuning queries for efficiency.
Experience in working with GIT repositories.
Experiences of Agile methodology and CI/CD practices.
Experience with task management tools (JIRA, Confluence)
Experience with Databricks and Pyspark/Scala/Spark SQL
Expert Knowledge of data governance principles to ensure data quality, lineage, and compliance.



Languages



Proficient Level of English (spoken and written)



Our offer:



Permanent contract
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports

Title: Analytics Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Flix, we offer a tech-driven environment where innovation meets real-world impact, with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a culture of collaboration and ownership.‚ÄØ

We are trailblazers in data-driven marketing. We firmly believe that successful marketing is rooted in high-quality data, and our commitment to support marketing teams with reliable data solutions is what sets us apart. You will work in a talented team of data engineers, data scientists & a product owner, delivering data products and models that empower marketing teams to take optimal budget steering decisions.

About The Role


Use Python, SQL, and Airflow to design and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines that deliver timely, actionable insights to marketing stakeholders.
Apply analytical thinking to understand complex data requirements and translate them into efficient data pipelines.
Ensure data quality through validation, monitoring, and clear documentation.
Proactively debug and refactor data pipelines to enhance performance, accuracy, and maintainability, based on a solid understanding of the underlying business logic.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering best practices within the team.
Collaborate with the Product Owner and cross-functional teams to understand marketing stakeholders' data needs and translate them into technical solutions.
Assist with ad hoc requests and help resolve data-related issues by applying both technical and analytical problem-solving skills.
Participate in the continuous improvement of data infrastructure by optimizing pipeline performance, enhancing data models, and integrating scalable, future-proof solutions.


About You


You‚Äôve had hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and Git.
You hold a degree in Computer Science or a related field. Candidates from Business or Marketing backgrounds with strong technical experience are also welcome.
You think critically, ask insightful questions, and enjoy turning complex business requirements into clean, effective code.
You are experienced with relational databases and excel at writing complex SQL queries.
You thrive in team settings, communicate well, and are fluent in English.
Bonus: Experience with Airflow, AWS, terraform, CI/CD tools; having worked in Marketing Domain.


We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you!‚ÄØ

What We Offer


Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family.
Work from (M)Anywhere: Depending on your role, work from another location for up to 60 days per year.
Hybrid work model: We are an office-first company, but we offer flexibility to balance work and life.
Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members.
Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills.
Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career.


To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, we empower our teams to push boundaries and shape the future of mobility. As we continue to scale globally, we harness cutting-edge technology to make mobility smarter, more sustainable, and more affordable.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place where you can drive change and redefine how millions of people travel, Flix is the place where you can lead your journey!

Title: Data Analyst 1, Entry Level
Description:
The New York State Office for People With Developmental Disabilities (OPWDD) is responsible for coordinating services for New Yorkers with developmental disabilities. The Data Analyst 1 will work within the Bureau of Business Analytics and Research to oversee operational research, program evaluation, data reporting, and analytics, while specifically focusing on SharePoint solutions.




Responsibilities

Developing SharePoint data collection tools using PowerApps and Power Automate
Ongoing maintenance of existing data collection tools and sites
Collaborating with project managers and end-users to gather requirements and deliver effective solutions
Creating and configuring SharePoint sites, lists, libraries, workflows, and web parts
Customizing SharePoint workflows to automate business processes
Monitoring SharePoint performance and troubleshooting issues
Maintaining documentation related to design, configuration, and support procedures
Fulfilling change requests
User support and training
Collaboration with ITS staff
Staying current on SharePoint and Microsoft 365 updates, recommending improvements and enhancements as needed




Qualification




Required

Non-competitive: bachelor‚Äôs degree and either: satisfactory completion of a two-year traineeship or two years of experience in data visualization, and statistical models and data mining tools.
Substitution: A master‚Äôs degree in data or computer science, informatics, economics, statistics, mathematics, or a related field, may substitute for one year of the specialized experience.
A Ph.D. in the above fields may substitute for two years of the specialized experience.




Preferred

Demonstrated SharePoint experience, including custom application development, workflow automation, and site customization.
Proficient in Power Platform (Power Automate, PowerApps) and Microsoft 365 integration.
Excellent communication, organization, and project management skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team-based setting.
Experience analyzing and managing data using SAS (or SPSS) and visualizing data using Tableau would be a plus.

Title: New Grad Data Analyst
Description:
Phoenix Tailings is a rapidly growing clean mining and metals production startup dedicated to sustainable and economic critical metals production. They are seeking a driven, innovative Data Analyst for their Leadership Development Program, which aims to immerse individuals in chemical process development and prepare them for future leadership roles within the company.




Responsibilities

Analyze and synthesize data across R&D, operations, and supply chain to support strategic business decisions
Build data pipelines and dashboards to monitor critical metrics across our clean metal production workflows
Identify inefficiencies or opportunities for process improvement using data-driven insights
Collaborate with engineers and scientists to model and interpret experimental results
Leverage statistical tools and machine learning models to forecast demand, optimize inputs, or detect anomalies
Assist in developing and standardizing data governance and documentation practices
Present actionable findings to cross-functional teams and executive leadership
Support the integration of new tools and analytics platforms to enhance business intelligence capabilities




Qualification




Required

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data manipulation and analysis
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Solid foundation in statistical analysis and problem-solving
Passion for sustainability, innovation, and clean technology
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset

Title: Entry Level Data Analyst
Description:
PNY Technologies, Inc is an American manufacturer of flash memory cards, USB flash drives, solid state drives. They are seeking a Data Analyst to develop reporting tools and ensure the accuracy of worldwide reporting while collaborating with various departments to analyze company data.




Responsibilities

Understand, utilize and implement new reporting tools like Power Bi
Work closely with IT to develop reporting tools in Power Bi, Excel, etc.
Partner with different departments to prepare and analyze company data
Collecting and analyzing data from various sources, such as supply, inventory, forecasts, and market trends
Developing and maintaining reports, Power BI Dashboards, and metrics to measure and evaluate the performance within individual departments
Data Cleaning and Preparation: Ensure data quality by cleaning and preparing datasets for analysis, including handling missing values and filtering data.
Statistical Analysis: Perform statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Data Visualization: Create visualizations to represent data insights clearly and effectively using tools like Power Bi, Tableau, or similar.
Predictive Analysis: Utilize machine learning techniques to forecast future trends and outcomes based on historical data.
Strategic Planning: Assist leadership with strategic planning by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.
Assist with special projects and in other areas, as assigned.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or equivalent in Accounting or related field
2+ years relevant experience
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail a must
Ability to adhere to strict deadlines
Strong knowledge of accounting principles & experience with Excel, Power Bi, Cube/Data Warehouse
Good written and oral communication skills, including ability to communicate effectively in English

Title: Analyst, Analytics (New Grad & Entry Level)
Description:
Publicis Media is a leading media agency network, and they are seeking an Analyst to join their Analytics team. The role involves analyzing media performance, generating actionable insights, and producing reports to optimize media strategies for clients.




Responsibilities

Analyze media performance across multiple channels and identify actionable insights.
Calculate and compare KPIs using dashboards, Excel and other tools to support business reporting.
Write basic SQL queries to extract data from internal databases.
Produce campaign performance updates, hindsight reports and ad-hoc analysis.
Summarize key findings and trends through clear and concise reports and presentations.
Collaborate with internal teams to identify performance drivers and inform recommendations.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor's degree in quantitative, marketing, or communications-related field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Marketing, Business, Data Science, etc.)
1+ year experience working with data sets using Excel and SQL in an academic, internship or professional capacity.
Intermediate to advanced Excel and SQL skills required (pivot tables, IF statements, joins and lookups, etc.)
Proficiency visualizing data in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to QA others‚Äô work as well as your own.




Preferred

Experience with media metrics or marketing data sources via coursework, internships, or entry-level roles is a plus.
Familiarity with BI/dashboard tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio strongly preferred.
Exposure to Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Meta Ads Manager or similar platforms is helpful but not required.

Title: Data Analyst (CRM), Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

NMQ Digital is a fast-growing digital services company that specializes in supporting multinational companies with various digital marketing solutions. They are looking for a Data Analyst (CRM) to design data pipelines, analyze marketing campaign performance, and collaborate with teams to optimize strategies.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design and maintain integrated data pipelines combining CRM platform data (e.g., SFMC) with web analytics (Google Analytics) for unified campaign reporting.

‚Ä¢ Analyze email marketing campaign performance: open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and revenue impact.

‚Ä¢ Conduct A/B tests on email subject lines, content, and CTAs; analyze results to recommend optimizations.

‚Ä¢ Develop interactive dashboards and reports (Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio) that provide clear, actionable insights on campaign effectiveness and customer engagement.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate closely with marketing, sales, and data engineering teams to understand data needs and support campaign strategy.

‚Ä¢ Validate data quality and ensure compliance with privacy and security standards.

‚Ä¢ Identify trends, anomalies, and customer behavior patterns to optimize marketing strategies and customer retention efforts.

‚Ä¢ Support segmentation and personalization initiatives by leveraging CRM and behavioral data.

‚Ä¢ Assist in the creation of customer retention models and customer lifetime value (CLV) analysis.

‚Ä¢ Provide insights and recommendations to improve multi-channel marketing efforts and overall customer journey.

‚Ä¢ Document processes, dashboards, and data definitions to ensure transparency and reproducibility.

‚Ä¢ Mentor junior analysts on CRM data best practices and analytics techniques.




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing Analytics, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or a related field

‚Ä¢ 2 years of experience in CRM analysis, marketing analytics, or data-driven campaign optimization

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of CRM platforms, preferably Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) or similar

‚Ä¢ Experience integrating marketing data from multiple sources (e.g., SFMC, Google Analytics)

‚Ä¢ Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, DOMO)

‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and campaign optimization

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies, segmentation, and conversion funnel analysis

‚Ä¢ Understanding of marketing KPIs: open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, revenue attribution, engagement metrics

‚Ä¢ Awareness of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and best practices for data compliance

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills; ability to translate technical findings into actionable business insights




-Preferred:

‚Ä¢ advanced degree preferred




Company:

NMQ Digital (formerly known as IST@ease) is a global provider of digital marketing execution services.

Title: Data Entry Specialist
Description:
```html




About the Role:

This role entails data entry of a high volume of invoice entries.
The ideal candidate will be able to work both independently and collaboratively within a team, as well as having daily interaction with internal and external stakeholders.
The position is fast-paced and requires the ability to work both quickly and accurately.







Schedule & Work Environment:







Onsite the 1st day, then mostly remote with occasional meetings onsite.
Flexible with scheduling/hours if needed.










Responsibilities:







Accurately and efficiently enter invoices on a daily basis
Manage workload to meet Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
Identify and resolve issues promptly and proactively
Research and resolve vendor payment discrepancies and related issues
Meet deadlines and maintain workflow
Review invoices for correct approval, G/L coding, accuracy, and compliance to corporate policies
Interact professionally with international, domestic, and foreign vendors, as well as corporate stakeholders
Build and maintain effective relationships with key stakeholders




Required Skills:







Typing speed of 60+ words per minute
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain productive working relationships
Capable of working both independently and collaboratively in a team environment




Equal Opportunity Statement: We are committed to diversity and inclusivity.




```

Title: Data Relationship Analyst (Entry Level) (Remote)
Description:
Job_Summary:

R.W. Mercer Co. is seeking a Remote Data Relationship Analyst to identify, analyze, and manage relationships between data entities across systems and business domains. The role involves collaborating with various teams to ensure data accuracy and facilitate high-quality decision-making.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Analyze data structures and define entity relationships across platforms (e.g., customer, product, transaction, vendor, or compliance data)

‚Ä¢ Create and maintain data dictionaries, ERDs (entity relationship diagrams), and metadata documentation

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and business users to ensure accurate and consistent relationships between datasets

‚Ä¢ Map data flows and dependencies across systems and databases (e.g., ERP, CRM, data warehouse, cloud platforms)

‚Ä¢ Support data governance efforts by defining and enforcing relationship integrity rules (e.g., referential integrity, cardinality)

‚Ä¢ Participate in master data management (MDM), data lineage tracking, and data quality initiatives

‚Ä¢ Conduct impact analyses when data structures change or when new systems are introduced

‚Ä¢ Facilitate data integration and transformation logic for reporting and analytics use cases

‚Ä¢ Recommend improvements to data models and reporting structures to enhance relational consistency

‚Ä¢ Ensure documentation is up-to-date, accessible, and aligned with organizational data governance standards




Qualifications:




-Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelors degree in Information Systems, Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or related field

‚Ä¢ 2 years of experience in data analysis, data modeling, or business systems analysis

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in SQL and experience querying relational databases (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL)

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of data relationships, primary/foreign keys, joins, normalization, and dimensional modeling

‚Ä¢ Experience with data visualization or mapping tools (e.g., ER/Studio, Lucidchart, dbt, Power BI, Tableau)

‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical, communication, and documentation skills

‚Ä¢ Comfortable working remotely with cross-functional, distributed teams




Company:

R.W.

Title: HIM Coordinator
Description:
Job Title: Health Information Management Coordinator

Location: 100% Remote (EST preferred)

Contract Type: 6-Month Contract-to-Hire

Pay Rate: $20‚Äì$23/hour




About the Opportunity

We are hiring 2 HIM Coordinators to support the BCBSM Risk Adjustment Team as they manage a significant expansion in CMS RADV audit record retrieval. This contract-to-hire opportunity is ideal for professionals who can operate independently and deliver results without micromanagement. With over 200,000 records to retrieve, review, and submit, your skills will be critical to the success of this high-priority project.




Key Responsibilities

Retrieve, review, and process high volumes of electronic health records (EHR) for completeness, accuracy, and compliance.
Track documentation deficiencies using chart completion systems and assign follow-ups.
Serve as a resource for provider offices to support proper documentation and EHR navigation.
Convert paper records to electronic format with a focus on speed, accuracy, and HIPAA compliance.
Audit transcription and dictation to ensure timely, complete, and accurate recordkeeping.
Maintain strict data confidentiality in line with CMS, HIPAA, and internal policies.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

2+ years of Health Information Management (HIM) experience.
Solid understanding of EHR systems, documentation compliance, and provider interaction.
Self-starter with strong attention to detail and ability to handle a fast-paced, high-volume workflow.
Excellent communication and organization skills.
Proven ability to identify and implement process improvements in record handling and documentation workflows.




Additional Details

Start Date: ASAP
Remote: Yes (100%, EST preferred)
Contract Type: 6-month contract-to-hire
Work Authorization: Must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Description:
Spring Venture Group is a Kansas City-based digital insurance platform focused on Medicare health insurance distribution. The Junior Analytics Engineer will support the Analytics team in executing various projects, including data analysis, system implementation, and process standardization to enhance decision-making and operational efficiency.




Responsibilities

Develop and implement tools and methodologies to help departments identify, understand, and prioritize the most pressing business challenges.
Mine and analyze data from varied datasets, databases, and disparate internal systems.
Transform SVG data into actionable intelligence to aid in decision-making.
Responsible for designing and documenting solutions for complex internal business problems for automated systems solutions.
Consistently search for new opportunities to optimize individual departments via data analysis.
Consult with different departments to determine potential solutions in order to drive system changes and enhancements.

Validating the accuracy and integrity of database tables.

Title: Reporting Analyst (New Grad)
Description:
Maritz is a leader in designing and delivering solutions that help people and businesses be and perform their best. The Reporting Analyst role provides strategic data analysis for a large utility client, focusing on electric vehicle consumer incentive programs and other automotive clients, while developing data visualization efforts and engaging with clients to drive business performance.




Responsibilities

Leads Performance Analytics Team contribution to strategic business reviews of assigned accounts.
Strategically utilizes business intelligence knowledge and thorough understanding of core solutions offerings.
Develops and updates analytics dashboards of assigned accounts on an ongoing basis.
Emphasizes data storytelling, visualizing data into applicable insights and intuitive dashboards for client presentations and ongoing reference.
Incorporates client-facing skills with strategic presentation skills to establish a credible relationship with clients and prospects.
Serve as day-to-day client contact for analytics questions, requests, and thought leadership.
Acts as a subject matter expert, presenting analytic services and insights to clients in both pre-sale and post-sale situations.
Presents findings and recommendations to C-level clients in face-to-face meetings for client programs, emphasizing data-driven strategic insights to drive business performance, while following quality control processes as established by the Performance Analytics Leadership.
Conducts analyses to measure the effect of programs, campaigns, or other efforts.
Develops scope for ad-hoc analyses, executing as appropriate and converting ad-hoc analyses to standard offerings.
Consults other analytical resources to complete assigned client deliverables, and supports senior team members in their analyses.
Identifies appropriate data sources (internal, client, 3rd party) and gathers data in an efficient and timely manner.
Contributes to account team conversations to support crafting of strategic recommendations to client.
Visualizes and communicates findings in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical audiences.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, applied math, physics, computer science, operations research, or other quantitative program required.
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in serving clients in a business or marketing environment.
Excellent organizational and project management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience with analytics dashboard tools such as Power BI and Google Data Studio.
Experience with relational database systems and knowledge of SQL required.
Willingness to learn programming languages such as Python or R is expected.
Demonstrated ability to present complex models and ideas to decision makers using oral, written, and presentation skills.




Preferred

Experience with employee engagement, recognition, incentives, customer retention, and/or loyalty data a strong plus.
Experience with email campaign and web analytics a strong plus.
Master‚Äôs or similar advanced degree a plus.
Experience with behavioral science and/or behavioral economics a plus.
Show more

Title: Technical Support Specialist
Description:
Job Title: Technical Support Engineer (Level 2)




About the Role

We are looking for a Technical Support Engineer (Level 2) who is an excellent communicator, a strong problem-solver, and passionate about customer success. You‚Äôll work closely with product, engineering, and customer success teams to help our clients integrate, adopt, and scale with our cybersecurity e-learning platform.




This role goes beyond basic troubleshooting, it‚Äôs about analyzing issues at a deeper technical level than Tier 1 support. Your job is to identify the root cause of problems, surface well-documented findings to engineering when needed, and often resolve issues independently by guiding customers with best practices or identifying user misconfigurations. By doing so, you‚Äôll save engineers time and accelerate resolution, all while ensuring a smoother customer experience.




After an in-depth technical onboarding, you will support customers with integrating features like Phishing Simulation, SSO with provisioning, white-labeling (SMTP/DNS/domain), Office 365 email delivery, and API/Zapier integrations. You‚Äôll also act as a technical voice for customers, providing product feedback and helping shape the roadmap.




Key Responsibilities

Investigate and resolve complex customer issues escalated from Level 1 support.
Assist customers with: SSO integration and user provisioning, White-labeling setup (custom domains, SMTP configuration), Phishing Simulation setup and whitelisting (e.g., O365, Gmail), Email delivery and DNS configuration, API and Zapier integrations
Identify root causes for issues related to email delivery, false simulation events, and user behavior.
Maintain accurate and thorough case documentation in the support system.
Join onboarding calls with the Customer Success team when advanced setup is required.
Collaborate with Engineering and Product teams on bugs, escalations, and feature requests.
Contribute to the improvement of documentation, FAQs, and internal knowledge base.
Proactively identify trends in support requests and suggest product or process improvements.




Required Qualifications

Proven experience as a Technical Support Engineer, preferably in a product-focused environment.
Experience analyzing logs, HTTP headers, and API payloads.
Familiarity with email protocols (SMTP, SPF, DKIM, DMARC).
Clear and professional communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
Creative problem-solving mindset and empathy for customers.
Fast learner with the ability to self-manage and work cross-functionally.
Experience using CRM/helpdesk systems (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk, HubSpot).




Nice to Have

Experience with Active Directory and SAML-based SSO setups.
Familiarity with DNS, domain management.
Background in SaaS products or EdTech / cybersecurity tools.
Experience with learning platforms (LMS) or phishing simulation tools.
Basic scripting or query skills (e.g., Bash, Python, SQL).
Exposure to cloud-based environments (GCP, AWS, or Azure).
Show more

Your job is to identify the root cause of problems, surface well-documented findings to engineering when needed, and often resolve issues independently by guiding customers with best practices or identifying user misconfigurations. By doing so, you‚Äôll save engineers time and accelerate resolution, all while ensuring a smoother customer experience.


After an in-depth technical onboarding, you will support customers with integrating features like Phishing Simulation, SSO with provisioning, white-labeling (SMTP/DNS/domain), Office 365 email delivery, and API/Zapier integrations. You‚Äôll also act as a technical voice for customers, providing product feedback and helping shape the roadmap.


Key Responsibilities

  • Investigate and resolve complex customer issues escalated from Level 1 support.
  • Assist customers with: SSO integration and user provisioning, White-labeling setup (custom domains, SMTP configuration), Phishing Simulation setup and whitelisting (e.g., O365, Gmail), Email delivery and DNS configuration, API and Zapier integrations
  • Identify root causes for issues related to email delivery, false simulation events, and user behavior.
  • Maintain accurate and thorough case documentation in the support system.
  • Join onboarding calls with the Customer Success team when advanced setup is required.
  • Collaborate with Engineering and Product teams on bugs, escalations, and feature requests.
  • Contribute to the improvement of documentation, FAQs, and internal knowledge base.
  • Proactively identify trends in support requests and suggest product or process improvements.


Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Technical Support Engineer, preferably in a product-focused environment.
  • Experience analyzing logs, HTTP headers, and API payloads.
  • Familiarity with email protocols (SMTP, SPF, DKIM, DMARC).
  • Clear and professional communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
  • Creative problem-solving mindset and empathy for customers.
  • Fast learner with the ability to self-manage and work cross-functionally.
  • Experience using CRM/helpdesk systems (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk, HubSpot).


Nice to Have

  • Experience with Active Directory and SAML-based SSO setups.
  • Familiarity with DNS, domain management.
  • Background in SaaS products or EdTech / cybersecurity tools.
  • Experience with learning platforms (LMS) or phishing simulation tools.
  • Basic scripting or query skills (e.g., Bash, Python, SQL).
  • Exposure to cloud-based environments (GCP, AWS, or Azure).

Title: Junior Article Proof Reader IV (Remote)
Description:
Company Overview

341 Networks is a privately held IT services and consulting firm founded in 2001. We specialize in end-to-end network design, deployment, and managed services‚Äîfrom fiber and Ethernet infrastructure through ongoing monitoring and optimization. Our customer-centric approach ensures reliable, scalable networks that power business success for clients around the globe.

Role Title

Junior Article Proof Reader IV

Location

Remote ‚Äì United States

Job Type

Full‚Äëtime, Paid Position

Salary Range

$45,000‚Äì$55,000 USD per year (gross)

Responsibilities

Review and proofread articles for grammar, punctuation, spelling, and style consistency.
Verify factual accuracy of content against provided source material.
Ensure adherence to in‚Äëhouse style guidelines and client specifications.
Flag and document substantive editorial issues or discrepancies.
Coordinate with editors and writers to clarify questions and resolve errors.
Maintain production schedules to meet daily and weekly deadlines.

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree (or equivalent) and a minimum of 2 years‚Äô experience in proofreading or copyediting.
Proficiency in standard style manuals (e.g., Chicago Manual of Style, AP Stylebook).
Excellent command of English grammar, punctuation, and usage.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to manage repetitive tasks accurately.
Familiarity with content management systems and basic HTML is a plus.
Ability to work independently in a fully remote environment while meeting collaborative goals.

Perks & Benefits

Medical, dental, and vision insurance options.
401(k) retirement plan with employer match.
Paid time off, including vacation and sick leave.
Professional development stipend for industry courses and certifications.
Flexible working hours within U.S. time zones.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

341 Networks is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where every individual is treated with respect and dignity. We evaluate all applicants based on their skills and qualifications, and we do not tolerate discrimination in our hiring process. Our goal is to foster a supportive environment that values diverse perspectives and experiences. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to any characteristic not related to job performance.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
About Us:

American Technology Consulting (ATC) is a service-first tech company dedicated to helping businesses unlock their full potential through innovative technology solutions. We empower organizations to leverage data for smarter decisions and meaningful impact. At ATC, we foster a culture of growth and invite passionate individuals to join our team, contribute to impactful projects, and excel as data-driven problem solvers. We embrace diversity and welcome candidates from all educational and professional backgrounds, including recent Master‚Äôs graduates without prior technical experience.




Job Overview:

We are seeking driven, detail-oriented individuals to join our team as Entry-Level Business Analysts. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business challenges, analyze requirements, and help deliver efficient, impactful solutions. This opportunity is perfect for recent Master‚Äôs graduates eager to thrive in the dynamic field of business and technology consulting.




Key Responsibilities:

Partner with stakeholders to gather, document, and validate business requirements.
Conduct analysis to identify process inefficiencies and propose actionable improvements.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including workflows, process maps, and user stories.
Collaborate with technical teams to ensure business requirements are translated into effective solutions.
Support project planning, tracking, and reporting to ensure timely delivery.
Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and feedback cycles to refine deliverables.
Stay informed on industry trends and best practices in business analysis and consulting.




Qualifications:

Master‚Äôs degree.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and process mapping tools.
Familiarity with business analysis frameworks and project methodologies like Agile or Waterfall.
Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively.
Candidates must have U.S. work authorization.




Preferred Qualifications:

Internship or hands-on experience in business analysis or consulting.
Familiarity with tools like JIRA, Confluence, or Power BI is a plus.
Basic knowledge of SQL or database concepts is advantageous.




What We Offer:

Career Growth: Clear pathways for progression within a supportive environment.
Mentorship: Professional development and guidance from experienced mentors.
Diversity in Projects: Exposure to a variety of industries and innovative technologies.
Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, health insurance, and other perks.




Work Authorization Support:

H1B sponsorship or related visa support for eligible candidates.
Applications from individuals on F1/OPT are welcome.




Equal Opportunity Commitment:

ATC is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees can thrive.

Title: Vice President, Data & Analytics
Description:
About

Company DescriptionA division of Publicis Groupe, Publicis Digital Experience is a network of top-tier agencies designed to develop capabilities and solutions to enable growth and provide scaled access to the digital capabilities of Publicis Groupe in service of our clients. Together, the Publicis Digital Experience portfolio endeavors to create value at the intersection of technology and experiences to connect brands and people.Our model to transform every brand experience will help clients navigate, develop, and activate commerce in a way that will provide them with a future-proof model for modern marketing. With our unique expertise in consumer engagement, CRM, and commerce, Publicis Digital Experience powers brands and empowers people in a new era of creativity. An ever-changing landscape and the need for fluid thinking is just part of our problem-solving nature. Which means we're untethered from any specific medium or method‚Äîwe go where ideas will work best.We are an expanding network with more than 5,000 employees, with agency brands throughout our global offices. Publicis Digital Experience brands include Razorfish, Digitas, Arc Worldwide, Saatchi Saatchi X, Plowshare, 3Share, and the Publicis Commerce Exchange.Job DescriptionWe‚Äôre looking for an Analytics Leader to sit at the intersection of data, strategy, and business growth. This role is responsible for delivering smart, actionable insights across paid and owned media channels, informing audience segmentation, performance optimization, and measurement frameworks across the full customer lifecycle.You‚Äôll work closely with strategy, media, CRM, and new business teams to develop insight-driven narratives and frameworks that shape client solutions and agency growth opportunities. This is a hybrid role‚Äîpart strategist, part data analyst‚Äîwith a strong POV on how to connect customer behaviors to channel outcomes in both acquisition and retention environments.ResponsibilitiesAnalytics & Customer InsightsDevelop and optimize segmentation schemas for both CRM and paid media activation (e.g., RFM, LTV tiers, lookalikes, intent-based cohorts)Partner with strategists and media teams to connect audience signals to targeting, creative personalization, and channel selectionAdvise on how to best utilize existing data and identity data and signal capture opportunities to enhance modeling and segmentation strategiesMeasurement Leadership:Design multi-touch measurement frameworks aligned to business objectives (e.g., acquisition, conversion, retention, CLV, incrementality)Partner with media and CRM teams to implement attribution models, holdout tests, and lift studiesCreate scorecards, dashboards, and reporting frameworks to deliver clear, audience-specific performance insights across touchpointsRecommend KPI structures that integrate both engagement (open, click, impressions, views) and outcome-based metrics (sales, revenue, conversion rate)New Business & Strategic SolutioningContribute to new business efforts by developing audience POVs, use case models, and measurement strategies that differentiate the agencyPartner with strategy and solutions leads to shape CRM and data-driven marketing proposalsBuild scalable insight templates, personas, and frameworks for re-use in pitches and RFPsData Strategy & Infrastructure SupportCollaborate with data engineers, martech leads, and CDP/CRM owners to ensure data pipelines and tools support audience analysis needsRecommend data sources and enrichment strategies to improve segmentation and personalizationEnsure analytics methodologies are aligned across platforms (e.g., paid media dashboards, ESP metrics, CDP audiences)Qualifications10+ years of experience in marketing analytics, CRM/lifecycle analytics, or digital audience strategyDeep knowledge of both paid media platforms (Meta, Google, DSPs) and owned/CRM environments (Salesforce, Adobe, Braze, etc.)Proven ability to translate data into actionable customer insights and strategic directionFamiliarity with data visualization and BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI) and analytical tools (SQL, Python, or R a plus)Strong communicator who can tailor insights to both technical and non-technical audiencesExperience supporting new business, pitch strategy, or consultative solution development preferredAdditional InformationThe Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include:Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or moreMonetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and FertilityMonetary assistance and support for pet adoptionEmployee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balanceTuition AssistancePaid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and moreMatching Gifts programsFlexible working arrangements'Work Your World' Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility)Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliancesThe benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. Based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents.Publicis Digital Experience is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.Compensation Range: $163,210 to $234,570. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. Temporary roles may be eligible to participate in our freelancer/temporary employee medical plan through a third-party benefits administration system once certain criteria have been met. Temporary roles may also qualify for participation in our 401(k) plan after eligibility criteria have been met. For regular roles, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 8/15/25. #J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Entry Level Software Engineer - Data
Description:
Obsidian Security is a threat detection and posture management company for business-critical SaaS applications. The Software Engineer - Data role involves building high-quality data products and requires a blend of engineering and data analysis skills to support critical areas of the company's success.




Responsibilities

Participate in the engineering life cycle at Obsidian, with the primary responsibility of building data abstractions and data transformations that are at the core of our product.
You will write high-quality production code.
Develop and maintain flexible batch and real-time analytical pipelines that feed ML-based threat detection models.




Qualification




Required

You are an analytically inclined engineer who loves solving complex problems using data.
You possess strong algorithmic skills.
Have demonstrated experience working with data processing systems.
Extensive experience with Python and SQL is required.
BS/MS Computer Science or a highly quantitative discipline.
1-2 years of industry experience building high-quality data products is a must.




Preferred

Experience with dbt, Spark, or DuckDB is a strong plus.

Title: Testing Analyst (New Grad & Entry Level)
Description:
BNY is a leading global financial services company that manages, moves, and safeguards money for the world. They are seeking a Testing Analyst to assist in User Acceptance Testing and the development of testing procedures for new or modified applications.




Responsibilities

Assists in the preparation and execution of UAT (User Acceptance Testing) testing of new or modified applications/systems across multiple computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server).
Assists in the analysis and development of new or revised UAT procedures and processes.
Assists in developing test scripts.
Performs simple testing activities, based on test plans and scripts.
Assists in analyzing systems requirements for straightforward projects using established procedures. Helps resolve basic problems detected in testing.




Qualification




Required

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.
0-1 years of experience required, related internship experience a plus.
No sponsorship available.
